When you are in your area you are somewhat divided and away from other areas, so there is not this sense everyone can see you. Then the whole wall facing the parking lot is one giant window, so there is a ton of natural light, and you can have a view of outside, not just a wall. 

Also when I went there seemed to be a lot of 20-30 year olds, and it seemed to have a bit of a pick up vibe. But not in a sleazy way, just that if you were single you might actually meet a reasonable person here, since the clientele all seemed pretty nice/normal. 

And all this for $10 a month! I am pretty amazed.

I've been going to this gym for 3 years now.  It's open 24 hours which is great because I have a crazy schedule.  It is never too crowded & the new owners have really helped it out by keeping it very clean & maintaining all the equipment.

1. Small comfortable feel
2. Rear parking & easy card access
3. $35/mo single person

1. Can never find the remote to get bloomberg off the many TVs
2. Lacks a real ab machine
3. Can be cramped at peak hours; avoid

I attended a Yelp Fit Club workout at Fit Flex Fly and loved it! If you hate planning workouts but want to get stronger and fitter, this is the place for you. Trainers were fantastic, equipment is well cared for, and the space is well set up. Showers and lockers available in the locker room. Challenging workouts that can be modified to your fitness level. My only regret is that it's a solid 30 minute drive from my house. Give it a try, you definitely won't be bored!

I was there for the Yelp event last night and I was thoroughly impressed by the facilities and the staff. I used to work out pretty hard in college, but since then I have mainly ran, light lifting, and yoga. This class was a refreshing break from that routine. I also haven't been worked hard enough to were I feel as if I was going to puke in a long time. The quick, changing movements are not something I am used to/

The staff was energetic and encouraging. The equipment is well maintained and clean. It was overall a great experience that I will have to look into trying again. It would be nice if there was one downtown though, that is my only slight drawback.

I was invited to be a plus-one for the Yelp elite event last night and it was a great class. My usual workout either consists of running or yoga, so this was a great, challenging class. I really liked trying something different. I would highly recommend trying it out. If I lived closer, I would definitely look at getting a workout package. Overall, it was a great class and I look forward to trying out the unlimited trial some time soon.
First time here, very clean and opened. All machines look brand new. 8 miles vs 3 miles from home but worth a drive. Will definite return for my next workout.

Seriously the best spin gym in Reno! A lot of times when you first go to a gym it is intimidating but that is not the case with Escape. When you walk in it just seems like you're family. Everyone greets you and offers to help. That goes for not only the people working there but the clients. Everyone is so welcoming. The classes are amazing! Spin is hands down my favorite but POUND fit is quickly becoming my second favorite. Combine an amazing workout with great music and blacklights and the result is just magic! I also love that when you want you can mix up your cardio/workout routine with their variety of classes. If you are looking for a place to get your sweat on this is it!

I signed up for the Sunday night spin class at 7pm with 2 other friends. 1 class was $12 for 45 mins. This was the best cycling class I have taken so far! It's a very different experience than most gym spin classes. You spin in the dark with cool lighting, the music is loud and upbeat, with a video projection to watch the music videos. The workout is timed very well to the music. The instructor will guide you through different workouts on the bike and focus on different muscles. They also add in ab and arm workouts with dumbbells. And at the end of the class, they hand out a refreshing cold towel. This class was so fun and I am really excited to try it again.

Wow! My experience with this location has been extremely positive. All staff members including the manager have been very helpful, courteous and professional. 
There may be cheaper options but I'm not willing to give up their 24/7 operating hrs.

I've been going here for about a month now.  The staff is the staff.  Not friendly but not rude.  Most are college aged students.  The 5:30 spin classes are pretty good.  The gym is very clean, new and never "packed."  I've never had to wait for a cardio machine and rarely ever wait for any weight training station.  Also the basketball and racquetball courts never seem too crowded either.

One of the few items I use every time I go to LA Fitness is the 2.2 lb medicine ball. It has been missing off and on for a couple of years. Finally it disappeared completely several months ago. I have repeatedly asked to have it replaced to no avail. Really, how much is it to ask that there be a small medicine ball every time I go in.

Well maintained and looks clean. More equipped than the Ina/Shannon location. The personal training area however, is monopolized by some bushmaster. Soon as I stepped foot in there she had to jump in and intervene on my workout. Wouldn't even allow me use of a small portion of the floor away from her client session. I am free to workout in the personal training area at the other location which I miss right now since it is being renovated. Other than the bushmaster, it is a great facility.

Gross!  The bathrooms are disgusting.  The weight room is small af.  There are like two benches?  Um no thanks!  

This is the worst gym I have ever been to and I have been to quite a few LA Fitness locations.  The Glenside gym is better than this one so just drive up the road 5-10 minutes.  

Parking also sucks!

This location has been newly renovated. It used to be a Bally I think. I came once then and it was in really bad shape. It's cleaner and has definitely been updated. It is brighter, has some new flooring, and the staff even seem cheerier. 

The weights are heavy for lifters and there is a good deal of cardio equipment to get your heart rate up.

Great price, which is why a lot of people probably choose retro, however, this one is really small and especially tight in the weight area. I often find myself waiting for equipment, if you squat you'll always have problems getting in the (1) rack available for squats. Bro, please don't curl in that rack. Ugh.

Recently they have banned dead lifts. It's turning into a Planet Fitness, which is cheaper and probably a better choice if you don't need the squats or dead lifts.

Cardio area seems to be OK in terms of amount of equipment, though some is in pretty bad shape. Plastic pieces missing, dirty, etc.

Men's bathroom is in pretty sad shape. The sink area looks terrible.

I most likely will join elsewhere when my contract is up, but the location is great, so that's a bummer.

Not bad, most retro fitnesses aren't as clean as a high end gym. You get what you pay it. It is certainly not an expensive gym membership so I do not know what people are expecting when they sign up for 20 bucks a month.

It's very hard to get me upset about rude people especially those in the service industry; However, I can say that the service desk employees here are a lost cause.  They are rude every single time come here, never make eye contact, and symbolically and sometimes literally roll their eyes every time you ask for some assistance. It's a real bummer.

I joined because of how nice the staff was during my initial visit on a Sunday.  He was very laid back and honored the free trial visit day.  He was not pushy, didn't ask for a copy of my driver's license, and didn't require blood from my first born child.  Based on how cool he was, I joined the gym the very next day.  The management that is on duty Mon-Sat is a different story.  

You get what you pay for.  Fair amount of equipment, but just like other smaller gyms it's packed during busy times.  I've met a lot of good people while working out here.  When signing up, be sure to ask about all fees that will be incurred over the year.  In addition to the monthly fee there is a startup fee and an annual fee (2 separate things).

I have been going here for about 4 years. My main attraction was the price, it is much cheaper than the last gym I belonged to. 

It's pretty basic, a lot of cardio equipment, lifting equipment and free weights. They offer training sessions which I took advantage of and wish I hadn't because it was so expensive and it was mostly a gab session mixed with a workout schedule that could have done on my own. 

New management took over in the last year and things have definitely improved. It was getting sloppy for a while there.

No classes are offered and there isn't a studio space, but there is a movie room with an amphitheater and cardio equipment. I can easily do 45 minutes on the elliptical while watching a good action movie and not think too much about how tired I am!

I was technically a member at this gym from February of 2012 until this past February, though I stopped going months before that point.

When I signed up, I had great intentions of working out all of the time, but then my workload increased (okay, I AM listing off excuses, but whatever) and my back started hurting horribly to the point that I was having trouble walking (turns out I do have diagnosed back issues now.) I went in looking to cancel my contract -- thinking I just had to give two months notice. I had no idea upon signing the contract in February that it was a year-long commitment. It just wasn't made clear.

I ended up paying a bulk price at once to cover my membership without debits each month on my bank account, but that honestly still peeves me a little when I think of Retro. I just think contracts should be made more clear up front.

Otherwise, it's a pretty decent gym. $19.99/month, but they have some random bi-yearly charges, too, which would spike up the per month price if you really think about it. The bathrooms were clean and the machines were nice. I was always one of those girls who would go in the movie theater area - a nice perk.

Now if my boyfriend was the one writing this review, it would have 10 stars up top. He is there whenever he has a free second!

I bought their 3 month groupon since the gym is very close to my job and directly on my way home. The signage from the road sucks! I drove right up to the side of the building, I mean directly next to the curb, to see if it was open. 
Pros: 
          convenient from 295
          Good hours, most days 5am to 10 or 11 pm
           Many different types of machines
           
Cons:
            It is tight in there! Like 10 lbs of (!) In a 5lb bag. The machines are so close together it is dangerous. Yesterday I wasn't able to walk down the aisle to the women's locker, I had to step aside so we didn't collide. There is a yoga mat area w balance balls but only 2 people can be there at a time. There is a boss's desk or managers desk right next to the aisle too- right in front of where people work out. I Wil take pics and upload

There is a smoothie bar that is directly across from where people are working out. So while I am red paced and sweating on a elliptical, there are meat heads talking to the young girls up front 

The big stall in the women's bathroom doesn't have a lock. I get changed after work into my gym clothes and I have to use the lock knob  ( that is missing the pin that goes into the door frame) and pinch it together to hold long enough for me to change.

The lighting sucks! It's so fluorescent but dim, really hard to describe. 

Overall if you are looking to be in and out on a treadmill or elliptical you are fine, just suck it up. If you are looking for a great place to work out in diversified ways I would find somewhere else.

There is fit older woman, in comparison to the super young college kids that are there, that is nice. She seems to be invested in the place but other than that I'm not woo'd by retro fitness.

It's an okay gym. What would make it better is if they didn't lock you in and not let you out of the contract. I moved to an apartment that has a full functioning gym in it. Why would I pay for retro and go to it if I'm already paying in amenities fees at a gym in my building? I just don't think it's good business to force people to keep their membership if they really don't need it.

This is a fairly small YMCA then I am used to in my home state, but nonetheless it's a Y.  The staff are very friendly. The place is very clean. The pricing is YMCA standards so you can make your own judgements with that. Unless I find another activity. I plan to stay put for my son.
This gym is a grimmy meat market. Alway packed. Never any cardio machines available for me. Oh well, it's 10$.
Emma the manager is amazing and all the ladies that work here are amazing. I love the workout and my abs are coming along nicely!!!!

I've been climbing here regularly for a few months. I've also brought friends and relatives here for fun day-trips. The atmosphere here is great! The staff are friendly and helpful, and all of the regulars seem super chill and nice.

There is a top-roping section, a lead-climbing section, and a bouldering section. Like the other reviewers have been saying, it's a little smaller than the average climbing gym, but they still have plenty of space and interesting routes to try out. They are also apparently expanding the size of their gym in March 2017, which we are all excited about.

Sometimes it gets busy on weekends during peak children's birthday party hours (12-4). But I've never had a problem with the kids-- the staff keeps them well in-hand. And if it ever feels too crowded in the top-roping section, you can always just climb in the bouldering section, which the kids never use.

The only frustrating experience I've had here involved an over-billing issue. It took a good while for them to put me in contact with the correct billing manager, and it still took some time after that to get the issue resolved. However, this is the only negative interaction I've had with the place, so it was probably just a one-off.

All in all, I think this gym is great both for beginners looking for a fun one-time activity or for long-time climbers looking for a permanent gym.

First time rock climber and I became a quick pro. Much like Tom Cruise in the opening to the 2nd Mission Impossible movie's opening. Although he didn't have to fend off children.

The location was a pain to find. It is not well marked. Look for the tallest building.

I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. A good combination for a beginner. They were also good about feeding into my ego by complimenting me on my fast skills.

There are many levels in the facility to keep you interested. I will definitely check it out again.

There was a deal on Groupon (or was it Living Social?) for an intro to rock climbing class at this location, so a few friends and I decided to go check it out.  

I've been here once before so I knew where it was located, but if you're a first timer (especially if you're going at night) it is a real pain to find.  Just go back to where it looks like an industrial park and follow the brightly lit sign for the dance studio - PRG is right next door with an unlit sign...makes no sense, but whatever!

We checked in for class and met our instructor, Anthony, by the practice wall.  He showed us all the basics - how to put on the harness, tie a figure 8 knot, basic belays, etc.  After going through the groups for more like a one-on-one, he took us over to the taller walls.  Again he went through group by group to see if we were able to hook ourselves up properly and successfully get your partner to go up and down a route.  Once he determined we were good to go, we could climb on our own and had the remainder of the night to do so.

I really had a great time doing this!  Our class had seven people in it, but I thought Anthony did a really great job making sure each of us was comfortable and knew what to do.  I'll definitely go back here again and recommend the intro to climbing class!

Relentless Fitness is a small facility, and the incredibly dedicated and enthusiastic staff really seem to care about each client's wellbeing.  I'm a reluctant exerciser, but I'm inspired by the idea of transforming our family's future, and Marissa is my number one supporter in this.  My children really respond to her coaching and enjoy exercising with her fun stations.  Very grateful to have this resource in my neighborhood!

Drifted far north of my orbit to try this gym out, I've already been to 66th Street location a few times. Still can't believe I get free gym as a SilverSneakers member. The huge open area here is different, and being a Saturday afternoon I thought it would be packed but no. Maybe they were all Christmas shopping.  

It's always inspiring to see people my age and older working out and taking care of themselves. Pleasant young man greets you at front desk. As other reviewers mention, no pool or sauna is missed, but they are a bargain for the pay-as-you-go price. All equipment is spotless and the floor shiny clean, what's not to like?

It's tucked into a strip mall at an angle from Publix, can't be seen from the highway so they should put up a tall sign.

Spoke with Jeff over the phone, and he was super helpful, kind and very patient during my myriad of questions. Really helpful, fabulous employee, excellent representative.  Came by to join, and met the assistant manager John, a very professional, high energy human, toured me around the gym, showed me all the opportunities I have to work out. Including the extra spa features in the upgraded Black membership. I am very excited about the infrared therapy for its collagen producing benefits, and the massage tables. Morgan is the in gym personal trainer that offers FREE Instructional classes as well as personal goal and best practices for achieving your goal. I signed up for Black membership on the spot. Fabulous prices, twenty-four hour NO EXCUSES open time. I am looking forward to the judgment free Zone and all the great workout. Thank you to the dream team who invented a amazing priced gym. And it's decorated in my favorite color ..purple.

I was in Clearwater on vacation with my teenage son and paid a visit to the PF on Rt 19.  The first few days we went the staff was pleasant and although the gym was smaller than the PF back home, it was adequate.  However yesterday we walked in and were about to sign in at the main desk when a female staff interrupted another staff talking with us and stated that my son wasn't allowed to work out since we were from out of state.  I explained that another staff told us it was ok, but she got attitude and then proceeded to tell us that the only way my son could work out was if he paid $20 for a day pass.  Needless to say I was pissed off and won't be returning.  It's rather sad that they couldn't make a small concession to satisfy their customers.  As I said before, the gym is small but decent - especially for $10/month...

OK so I transferred from va to Florida and this location is the closest one to my house here in Florida. When I first walked in I was greeted by Preston who was very helpful . First impressions : it was small compared to the planet fitness I went. Equipment was older. One stand up tanning bed and one lay down tanning bed (not enough). No filtered water to refill your water bottles ( which my planet fitness had) The music was super low. the TVs were old and some were not working at all.  The locker room sinks definitely need replacing, they look dirty even though they are clean.  Everything in general just needs replacing... Old and dated. Overall  still a good place to work out... I'll go there for now bc it is close to my house. But I was told this location is getting an over haul in The summer ( of 2016)! So I'm super excited for that. I'm a black card member (20 bucks a month) for over a year now! And I've been more then thrilled with the facilities in Virginia. So  I'll be even happier to see new equipment, filtered water and new locker rooms... At this location...it should be the standard !But Preston your awesome keep up the good work!
If you're looking for challenging classes to get your heart rate up and burn calories, you've come to the right place.  Instructors are knowledgeable and motivating.

Super challenging, fun and effective workouts paired with an awesome staff. I've done their classes and I've done their personal training and highly recommend both! I worked with Mada and she whipped me into tip top shape right before my wedding and I couldn't be happier!

I belonged to this gym for about 4 years when I lived in the area. The monthly fee was a tad high ($43) & personal training was ridiculously high, something like $50 per half hour (I have no problem paying for quality, but it was not worth the cost). I liked that it was open 24 hours (except weekends) & there were always free machines & a variety of equipment. The staff is rude & there are a lot of douchey members. Lots of weight slamming & loud grunting. So basically, it's everything you would expect at a typical Gold's Gym.

I have been really happy with South RAC. I have been going there for two months now and am happy with the cleanliness of the facility and the staff. The size of the gym is nice as there is always space to workout, even when it is busy. I have also been doing personal training and Ja has been great. She is very supportive and does a great job building workouts to fit your goals and current ability.

I just joined!!! This gym is amazing. So much room to work out. Ask for Eric when you want to sign up. He is so hospitable. I used the track around the bball court and the ramps. I love cardio and they have so much to offer!! Also, Pilates!!! I am so in love with the location and the facility!

I have been going here for about 3 years and I absolutely love it. They have a wide variety of equipment, and a large facility. While there are a lot of members, it is set up so you never feel crowded or like your being watched. I really enjoy all the classes they offer- my favorites are Zumba and Spinning:). I definitely recommend this gym!

I really love SOUTH RAC! They are so friendly and I felt really comfortable there. I dig the abundance of TV's on their equipment. And their different weight and cardio areas. It was a little on the pricey side, but all good gyms are. If I didnt move clear across town I would still be a member here!

Love this gym.  Best gym I have ever been a part of.

There is something special about a locally owned non-chain gym.  The upper management are always available for complaints or questions.

The space is huge, even when it is busy, it still feels open.  And let's be honest, what gym doesn't get busy.

Basketball courts.  Group Fitness.  Spinning.  Anything you need.

Parking can be an issue on super peak times, but other than that this gym is perfect.  Don't go anywhere else.

An enormous gym with every piece of "functional training" equipment you can imagine.  Think NFL combine-type workouts.  Wanna push a sled? Check.  Weighted ropes? Yup. Pull-up cages?  They're got it.  The gym also has classes and an enormous variety of free weights, Smith machines, nautilus style equipment, rowers, etc.  Whatever you like, they have it. Though I don't have kids, it appears they also have day care area. 
The staff always seems helpful.  James Puccinelli is a wonderful trainer (look for the jacked 6'9" dude, you can't miss him) who will push you past the shadows of your limits.
Perhaps the best part is the clientele.  The gym is populated by relatively young, hard-training physically fit people who don't take all day on a given piece of equipment.

Super nice club, much larger than I anticipated. The staff was quite nice when showing me around. I ended up choosing to go with another gym and didn't give a fifth star for the sheer fact of that its very pricey, there's no way I'd be using so much in there as to rationalize the cost. However, if you're into specialty sports training in wide open areas, this place seemed pretty great.

This gym is great.  The price is good for what you get which is a nice facility, always working gym equipment, an amazing staff, clean lockers and showers, towels on greeting, on site daycare, and so much more.  This is an absolutely wonderful facility for people of all shapes, sizes and walks of life

The people here get an A+ in my book. Friendly staff, HUGE areas to work out and all the cool kids go here (In my book again).

I am very pleased with my decision to join south RAC and I will continue to suggest it to all my friends :) 

GET FIT or GO HOME!!!
South RAC is an awesome gym. Lots of workout space and variety. The employees are great. I love their Body Pump and Grit group workout classes!

Hands down the BEST gym in the Reno/Tahoe area. I might be biased but I speak only the truth. 

I have been a member for at least 5 years, maybe even longer and I have never had one bad day nor have I had to fight for space. SouthRac has definitely done a lot of improvements in their facility and every year they get better and better. 

SouthRac has other businesses inside its facility, so depending on what you're looking for, this place can be a one-stop-shop for wellness and fitness. There is a salon, acupuncturist, massage therapist, metabolic testing center and much more.

I typically come in during lunch hour M-F since I work around the area, but lately I've been coming in around 2pm to stay away from the "resolutioners crowd." Don't get me wrong, this place is HUGE that it never really feels "busy" in there. But I do enjoy the quieter time of the day. Cardio machines are located upstairs which overlooks 2 basketball courts, an indoor track, 2 racquetball courts, circuit weight training machines, open astroturf and the recently added incline ramp -- Shaun T would say "Amazeballs" to this. Strength training machines, heavy weights are mostly upstairs and the Group Ex room as well. They have great Group Ex classes with great instructors. If you ever want to try Zumba, take Dulce or Veronica's class because you will be hooked. Just last year, they also became a Les Mills gym that now offers various Les Mills classes. My favorite area would be the "Bat Cave". I do a lot of functional training and the Bat Cave is the best place to do this. The Bat Cave is covered with rubber floors which is great for plyometric exercises. In the Bat Cave you'll find battle ropes, rowing machines (another favorite), spin bikes, suspension training equipments, pull-up bars, lifting platforms, GHDs and also free weights. There are numerous plyo boxes, and even agility ladders that is accessible to all the members. I also appreciate that there are plenty of foam rollers for the members to use. In short, whatever it is that you like to do when working out, SouthRac has it. So really, you wouldn't have any excuse as to why you are not working out here.

Staff is very friendly, always greets you with your first name which I think is very personable and inviting. Locker rooms are well maintained with multiple shower stalls. You will also find a sauna in the locker rooms. I have never used the saunas so I couldn't tell you much about these.

Parking can be hard depending on the time of day you come so plan accordingly.  Or just think about it this way -- you're getting in your warm-up walking from your car to the entrance.

As you can tell, I have nothing but great things to say about this place. Try them out yourself and you will not be disappointed.

I have been a member of many gyms in Reno. The new ownership of South RAC (a few years now) have done a great job in making it what it is today. Even though there are over 2k members, you would never know this on most days because the place is so large. They do a great job updating and adding new equipment to keep the place feeling newer. 

The staff is all very friendly and Karl is always welcoming as well. It's nice to know my business is appreciated. I am also a member of a bootcamp (Fit U), which is also another great thing about the place. My trainer Ryan Golec is very knowledgeable and always teaches a class that makes me feel like I got my money's worth. Other great things: racquetball courts, driving range, indoor track, basketball courts. The only downsides is that the place doesn't have a pool and that the racquetball courts could be updated. Other than that, I have no complaints and because it is WAY better than any other gym I've belonged to (especially 24 Hour), I am still giving them 5 stars.
If only they had a pool.....then it would be the ultimate gym, right now its just a great gym.

I've been a member at SRAC for 3 years. I love this place. It might not be right for everyone, but I'll note down what keeps me a regular and extremely happy member:

-You can virtually always get on whatever equipment you wish to use, even during primetime hours. The parking lot may appear at times to be overrun, but a lot of those people are present for leagues, so don't let it scare you that the rest of the gym is overcrowded and you'll be sitting around, waiting for things to open up.

-I work out all the time during the boot camp classes. Sometimes I even work out in the same space they use downstairs. I've never had any problems. I used to be a trainer for many years and don't feel these guys overstep their bounds at all. I don't think they monopolize the track for long periods of time either.

-The customer service of the owners and staff is fantastic. In 3 years, I've never witnessed any bad behavior on their part personally. Karl and Gabe always know you by name. They talk with members and get to know them. The few complaints or problems I've had (minimal) have been met with quick and friendly response. The only staff member I felt had a problem with good service was their billing/accounting person. I talked to the GM and he took care of it within hours. Fantastic! Their front desk staff is trained to greet you, say goodbye when you leave, smile, and be friendly. Big points in my book. 

-If you are into functional training, this place is full of all the cutting edge equipment and the necessary space to use it. The indoor track rocks too. If you prefer traditional stuff, they have all that as well.

-Their operating hours seem quite reasonable to me. Gyms are not going to stay open til midnight if the traffic they receive doesn't drive it. If you need to work out after 10pm or before 5am, another gym would be a better option for you.

-Most of their long term, regular trainers seem well educated and up-to-date and good at what they do (as I have a degree in the field and worked in the business for a long time, I know how to rate what I see). I've never seen any of the men leer or sexually harass ANYONE (per another review here). I am a young and fairly fit female and have never had ANY such problems.

I was a member of LA Fitness before moving and this was the only gym close to me. When I first went there to check it out, I was heavily pressured to join and the monthly rates are expensive!  They also make you pay extra if you cancel your membership within 1 year. They had limited equipment and didn't have most of the features I liked that LA fitness offered.

I absolutely love Shred415 Indy! This studio feels like a community and the staff and instructors are all so friendly. I love being able to jump into the studio and get an amazing workout in for an hour every time I go and be done!

Very Impressed!

Stopped in while visiting from out of town.

The customer service was unlike any other. We visited another similar gym in Indianapolis and WOW! Can't even compare. Shred 415 was professional, welcoming and really went above and beyond to make sure we felt comfortable.

Workouts are HIGH Intensity. Exactly what we were looking for!

I love this place! China, Casey, and Andrew are rockstars and really put on great workouts. I never thought I would be a Crossfit person, but I love how challenging the workouts and how knowledgeable the instructors are.  I think they really do a lot more than just provide a Crossfit workout. They take more of a holistic approach, focusing also on diet, postural alignment, and general motivational tips which I definitely need when I joint a new fitness program. They consistently have workshops and member parties, creating a wonderful community to be a part of.  They also sometimes do fun outdoor community classes at beach.  My goal is that if I keep going, I will have a tush like China's (she's one of the instructors/owners)

Cross Fit Innate is one of the best gyms in Santa Barbara, all because of the amazing coaches!!! They are such a dedicated team and truly offer a comprehensive support system to set you up for success!! I especially love the workouts and recipes they offer online. Plus I love the complimentary classes they offer allow me the great opportunity to invite and expose my friends to a new way of working out. *Can't recommend them enough.

Very nice, clean, and modern rec center... I'm impressed.  The staff is super nice & friendly.  They have towels to use if you don't bring your own.  The swimming area is split into two - one side has lap lanes for serious swimmers while the other side is more for the kiddies (lazy river and water slide, although there are two lap lanes towards the back).  There's lots of exercise equipment to use and a walk/run around the indoor "track" gives you a little tour of the different sections of the center.   They have exercise classes, but I haven't tried any so can't comment on those (but you do need to pay extra to enroll).  If basketball is your thing, there always seems to be people playing on the courts.  Also, I'd love to try out the climbing wall sometime post-pregnancy.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. The instructors are great, the owner is such a sweetheart, the classes are challenging, the other students are positive and nice and I always feel comfortable there. The schedule works great for me and all the yin offered is really doing wonders for me. Did I mention I LOVE IT HERE?? Also, she does some great offers, like $30 for your first month unlimited! How can you say no to that?

While my Saturday morning boot camp takes a few weeks off, my friend and I decided to give hot yoga a try. This place has a great deal for first time students so we paid $30 for a month of unlimited yoga. We both enjoyed the class and can't wait to go back when our schedules allow. I tried a hot yoga class years ago in Sarasota and it's as good as I remember it. If you are wanting to switch up the routine then I say def check this place out.

Great gym, a little on the small side but they have really nice people that work there and try to develop a community culture.  The smoothie bar is a lot of fun and they have a good variety of classes.  Of course, because it's a good gym, it's always packed.  

Could clean the machines a little more frequently, I would work out in the AM and there would be hairs all over the floor.  The maintenance could use some improvement, a lot of treadmills don't have functioning televisions.

Planet Fitness is a great place for people who are beginning their fitness journey. It's well-known that PF's are well-stocked with cardio equipment. In fact, this location recently got all new cardio machines and I'm fairly certain there are more machines than before. There are plenty of TV's which are visible from the cardio area. 
Like any gym, this place gets crowded on weekday evenings. If you want to use anything besides cardio machines, you may have to wait for a machine or change your workout plan. This PF location has a massive parking lot and locker rooms, so that's not even a problem on weeknights. 
I have 1 small problem with this location, and it hasn't happened at other PF's I've visited. I am OBSESSED with the "30 Minute Express" area. Seriously, if you're a beginner, you must try it! But at this location, there are ALWAYS (seriously, always) people in the 30 Minute Express room who just sit at one machine and don't do the rotation. I wish the PF staff would monitor that room. Still, I think this is a 5-star gym for people who are novices or are trying to lose weight.

Summary: Can't beat the value at Planet Fitness, but it's not for the serious weight-lifter (see below).  
Pros: 
$10/month ($20/month for the Black Card membership - if you want free massages and the ability to bring a guest with you at any time) PLUS a yearly membership fee ($20-30, can't remember exactly). 
24 hrs
Friendly staff
Clean
Other gym-goers are friendly and low-key
Tons of cardio machines and a good selection of strength training machines
Area in the back with battle ropes, medicine balls for slams, kettlebells
Massage chairs and beds!
Not super-crowded; I usually go around 4:30 p.m. on weekdays and weekends at 9-10 a.m.

Cons:
No squat rack (3 Smith machines only, and you usually have to wait for these)
No deadlifting area
Free weight area is kind of small and usually a bit crowded
Missing some pretty standard machines (lying leg curl, hack squat, isolateral row machine)
Only one leg press machine (unless you count the two sitting ones with the pins instead of  plates but they only go up to ~170-180 lbs and it's a different movement due to the different angle)

So, if you really want to squat and deadlift, look elsewhere.  Otherwise, it's a great gym for the cost.

The facility was clean and I enjoyed working out here while I was in town for a few months. I would like to acknowledge Brittany for being an exceptional manager and doing the right thing! She went above and beyond to help rectify an important situation and deserves credit for having good business sense and treating customers fairly and appropriately. If she continues in this manner I have no doubt that she will excel in business. Planet Fitness and/or any other company should take note of her ability to do the right thing and treat clients appropriately!

Okay, I am new to Planet Fitness, and thus far...I am VERY IMPRESSED !!!!
First of all, the staff is amazing, the ones I met anyway. My daughter and I went in to join, and for only $1.09 each...we are members!!! Our monthly payment of $10 plus taxes ($10.53) is taken automatically out of our checking accounts on the 17th of each month.

Then they gave us a new Tshirt, a sticker for my vehicle, a list of all the classes they offer and the best times to enjoy the facility. Before we joined they allowed us to wonder around the facility to check it out. There are two memberships...simple White or Black !!
The White membership for $10 plus taxes gives you 24/7 availability of the equipment and the classes/personal trainers. You can also go to any other Planet Fitness but it will cost you an extra $5 for those visits and your membership card is needed. 
Black Membership for $20 plus taxes gives you the same 24/7 availability of the equipment and the classes/personal trainers. But if you go to other Planet Fitness in the USA, it is free. Also with this membership you get to take a friend for FREE...the visitor as total access to all of the equipment with you. Also, with this membership you get full access to the RELAXATION area, which is the tanning beds, the hydromassage tables and the massage chairs. 

 If you bring a your own lock, you can also use one of the many lockers in the locker room. I love  the locker room area. It is large, with showers, plug ins for blow dryers, great large mirrors, and normal bathroom needs. 

The equipment is amazing !! There are rows and rows of treadmills, elliptical machines, stationary bicycles, tons of different weight machines to work different sections of your body. Each machine has photo description on how to use the piece of equipment or you can have someone help you out and show you, NO ADDITIONAL COST..you can also get a personal trainer for FREE as well that will work out a work out regiment for you to follow if you are trying to reach certain goals. Right now !! ME !!! I am just trying to build up a better Cardio routine and burn some fat and loose some weight.. Wish me Luck!!! 

If you are looking for a change and a New Gym...check out Planet Fitness!!!
Nice gym with friendly staff, but some equipment and lockers def showed signs of wear.

Greta, Louisiana ---

A day at Planet Fitness doing a partial pARTy Fitness session ...

The "Greta" location is ok ... plumbing maintenance would get 1 useless shower working ... 

I am still a fan of Planet Fitness ... it works for "Run-A-Way Bill" 

day 035 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA) 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here! 

#RunAwayBill #PlanetFitness #DUSA2017 

03.29.17

No judgement free circuit zones for me.  I have a FREE gym membership with my job, but a one hour trip to the gym, turns into 2 because I have to wait for machines... Spent two weeks in the Charlotte area and was a guest of a member at the area locations.  I fell in love with the order and convenience of the 30/12 minute circuit program and the customer service.  Returned to New Orleans and joined...  Service- 2-3 ppl behind the counter looking down.  Circuit- 30/12 minute areas used as personal gym, when I attempt to get to the next station (in order), the other members get irritated or will not move, they will not wipe down machine because they are annoyed. The time I spend walking to the counter for the staff/manager to say, our policy is... (NOT OUR PROBLEM), we have to stay at the counter... is using up my gym time.  Then they share that everyone complains about it... and another member curses out members who do not move (put him on the payroll and I will schedule time with him!).  There is a white board that states a policy, they CHOOSE not to enforce. I even started attempting to find you a solution; guess what you have camera's in those areas????  You can monitor from the counter. I joined because of the 24 hr circuit availability and the service I received in Charlotte. One FB post, 3 conversations with staff and 2 suggestion box submissions later, I had to cancel my membership.  I guess you have enough members.  What really annoys me is, I recommended PF circuits to about 50 ppl when I returned... I am so embarrassed.  If everyone says the program is broken, get rid of it; continuing to market something you cannot manage is false advertising.  Throw out the red/green light and white board that says you will ask someone to leave or cancel their membership.  I really do cancelling my membership but I cannot to take my quality time to manage your members or program. Such a great unmanageable concept....

OUTSTANDING SERVICE BY THE REGIONAL MANAGER- Verushka Lagos!!!! FIVE STARS FOR HER RESPONSIVENESS!!!  You need to find 20 more of her!  I may return once I move..

Not impressed. I understand only having 4 treadmills when starting out, but this little place is jam packed around 5PM and there is nothing available. Then they take out an additional $25 on top of your membership every few months and take suggestions on a new piece of equipment although I'm not sure where they plan on putting all this stuff. I think it's overpriced as well. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would recommend going in the mornings as it is empty between 6-8.

I joined this Anytime Fitness location soon after they opened because they were .5 miles from our house -Perfect! They offered a pretty good deal so we signed up for a one year contract. We normally go around 430am-5am so it is never really busy however there are 4-5 people typically there around that time. We've enjoyed our membership however things have changed for us...


We are getting ready to buy our first home but it is across town in Irvington. There is a YMCA and Golds Gym less than a mile away near Irvington... not ideal but the closest anytime fitness is 6-7 miles away! So I email Anytime Fitness about cancelling my membership and why. They say thats fine no big deal and ask for my new address. I give it to them and they said since there is one 6-7 miles away then they will transfer my membership. Keep in mind that we are in a CITY and you shouldn't have to drive 6-7 miles to your gym at 430am. I let them know my concerns (all via e-mail) and they said they will look into it. That was 10 days ago and I have not heard back.

I had heard about Anytime Fitness' contracts being hard to get out of but its not like I don't want to cancel because I don't use it. 

Just beware if you are thinking about joining... there probably will be no way out. And be sure they don't "auto renew" your contract like they did ours (and most people's) otherwise you have to send them a written letter telling them not to renew and if not... you're stuck for another year. 

I'll keep my fingers crossed that this works out... otherwise its $80 a month down the drain until my membership is up.

**update** I finally got an answer about cancelling mine and my fiance's membership. Total cost $346

The staff is so helpful. The gym may be smaller than your usual mega club but it makes up for it with clean facilities, a friendly and attentive staff, and 24 hour access. I have been very pleased with my membership, especially with the new owner. Great place.

This gym is cool and is in the middle of Channelside downtown. You must workout during the day Cuz after 500 pm it's crazy busy in there. The employees are mostly friendly but not overly friendly. I love all the options it has to work out. I love the free massage chairs for after my work out. Parking is a pain and is not very convenient.  Overall, I enjoy it and will continue to come to this gym during off hours.

Hi-energy gym!! I joined in Atlanta and was visiting Tampa and able to use my Perms Plus membership in Tampa. I took the yoga class which was nice. The gym is bigger and has more equipment than the Perimeter location in Atlanta. Parking in the garage was free up to two hours and I got to guest passes for local coworker.

Nice new Crunch which overtook the old Powerhouse location at Kennedy and Meridian. It's a smaller club (than the old PH) but has the essentials for what you need.

The gym has a good layout. Benches and dumbbells in one area, power racks, machines, cardio, turf and they kept the Santa Monica stairs which I think was a smart move since it's unique only to this location. I've been several times but this last time was the first time I went since they finished the renovation. I was there on a Friday night so I think, as far as crowds go, my view was a little skewed. I'm not sure about the other "peak" days of the week but I could see it being a little crowded.

The exercise room is in what I would consider being in an odd location. The walls are all glass and if you're someone who is taking a class it's almost as if you'll be on display. That may cause some hesitation for some. 

Overall, I think it's a nice gym for the price. If you can train at an off peak time I think you'll find it suitable.

Where was I before Orange Theory? Oh that's right, on my couch drinking wine every night complaining about not being in shape. I had a friend that praised this place and after awhile when one popped up in mid city, I decided to give it a try. Initially I said no because of the price, but once you calculate the cost it's really not so bad. Health is wealth baby. Immediately from my first class, I knew I had made a good decision. Not only was the staff extremely welcoming and personable, but I loved everything about the concept. It literally pushes you to work harder and get in shape. I don't have the drive to do it on my own, so fortunately this was exactly what I needed. I've been coming for 3 months now and no workout has ever been the same. I love the energy when u walk inside. For people like me who have extremely hectic and inconsistent work schedules, this is perfect. All you do is download the app and you schedule according to what works best for you. They have classes all day at all different times. If your wondering about bringing headphones or making a playlist, don't bother. The instructors have the music bumping when u walk in. I haven't taken everyone's class, but Brandon, Jeff, and Josh's music selection definitely will have you in the zone. Everyone needs a little trap music in their life lol. If I haven't convinced you by now, then go in and see for yourself. They willingly will give u a walk through and let u do a trial class. Thank me later!

Talk about an intense workout!
From treadmills to row machines to floor/strength work OTF is the most intense and gratifying workout I have ever tried.  Keep track of your own stats and progress with the heart monitors and get your results afterwards and in your email.  The music, like the workout, is face paced and high energy.  No workout is ever the same! Keep your muscles guessing as you reach the "orange zone." So far after several classes I average about 540 calories burned.  But NOT including the afterburn--orange theory effects!

Lots of classes and lots of experienced black belts. They will show you proper defense in any situation. Because off them and other jiu jitsu teachers throughout the california paragons I.am not afraid to defend myself against any man lol :)

I love Paragon! As a woman, most MMA, kickboxing, and/or jiu jitsu gyms intimidate me but the atmosphere here is truly awesome! The coaches are all super friendly and encouraging. Not to mention it's the best workout! I always leave my workouts feeling strong and refreshed, which is exactly what I go there for! The coaches are great about making sure that I learn the proper technique which is really helpful! I also love what a strong sense of community Paragon has. Sean, the owner, is really good about planning fun events for all of the members as well as hosting fun fundraiser events, watching fight nights on pay per view, holding classes at the beach/on the sand and doing other things to mix it up and keep it fun while bonding with fellow members! Paragon is amazing and I would encourage anyone who's interested in kickboxing, jiu jitsu or MMA or anyone just looking for a fun new workout to try this place! I can guarantee you will get hooked!!!

Paragon Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is exactly what its name implies. I've become a better Paragon of myself ever since I started training there. Everyone knows that Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is not for the faint of heart. You're expected to train hard and give great effort, and you reap great rewards for doing so. Paragon has an awesome group of instructors (with more than one of great renown in the BJJ world), each of them offering a unique perspective and insight on improving your BJJ game. Best of all though, it's fun!

This reviews the BJJ discipline at this place. This place is the cleanest Brazilian Jiu Jitsu academy in the world! When you walk in the front door you will see exactly what I am talking about. The mat space is also one of the biggest I have ever seen at a BJJ gym. Franjinha and Sean's teaching styles compliment each other so that students get the best of both worlds. What I really like about their styles is that you can train as a hobbyist or you can also train like BJJ is your life. They also have a great kids program. The kids instructors understand what kids need and want. From the moment you walk in this place you will be welcomed here like it is your own. Franjinha (the founder) has always been a true leader and has perpetuated this philosophy to his students. In every class there are extremely talented BJJ players to train with. If you come on the right day, you may get to roll with world renowned athletes like Jeff Glover or Bill Cooper. These guys will leave you wondering what just happened. Keep an eye out for this school, they have been opening up locations in California, Texas, and Sweden and continue to be on the podium stands at the high level international/national tournaments. Go check it out and see for yourself.

I train BJJ in Chicago, IL,  was in town visiting family in SB and wanted to continue my training while on vacation. The staff at Paragon was very friendly, welcoming, and informative. I really enjoyed the clean facility and the training. I would highly recommend this location!

i've trained casually at various MMA gyms in the LA area and decided to try out Paragon at the recommendation of a friend. although I had "trained" before, going to a new gym is always nerve-wracking when you are not yet familiar with the setup... where do i put my bag? should I be wearing muay-thai shorts? is anyone wearing a mouth guard? how in shape am i REALLY? will i or will i not be the worst one in the class? suffice it to say, my anxiety was misplaced. the atmosphere at Paragon is so friendly and unpretentious (refreshing, after exposure to some more uppity LA gyms). i took a saturday am all-levels kickboxing class with Tyson, who leads a damn good workout and helps you with technique. it was a perfect mix of cardio and sparring combinations. needless to say i was the-good-kind-of-sore come sunday. 

gym quality is top notch. they had apparently just put in new mats which looked and felt great. the gym is huge so there was plenty of room for solid training, and everything was super clean. 

special hats off to the owner, Sean. he was really welcoming when I first awkwardly stumbled in. you can seriously tell how engaged he is with the gym and its members. he seemed to know everyone by name, regardless of whether they're gunning for their black belt, or just looking for a good weekend workout.

I too had been auto billed due to my membership when I moved to SF, although I spoke to Sean, the co-owner, and he immediately refunded my money that was billed by the 3rd party company. Him and the rest of the team were extremely helpful with not only my refund, but also giving me the proper coaching and sense of direction during my BJJ and Kickboxing training. I loved how friendly and chill everyone was at Paragon...absolutely no discrimination. The sense of family and academy pride was palpable.

Started training at Paragon Summer of 2011 and ended in Dec 2012 to move to SF. Love the people, trainers, culture and atmosphere of Paragon. Jeff Glover a legendary  BJJ World Champion and one of the best all time American BJJ practitioners started here and received his black belt from Alliance BJJ Black Belt Ricardo Franjinha Miller, the owner and founder of Paragon. I took more of the Kickboxing and Muay Thai, as I have more of a stand up background than grappling.

Def recommend this to anyone...don't be shy. lol

I've lived in Santa Barbara for over 3 years and have been a member at Paragon for over 2. The academy became a second home for my husband and I to train, learn the arts, and work on our fitness/wellness. The instructors are very knowledgeable, helpful, and truly spend the time to get to know you. The members are welcoming and before you know it, strangers turn into friends. Highly recommend and watch out, it gets addicting (in a good way, of course)!

Paragon Academy is a Great facility! It has all the equipment you need; machines & free weights and also stationary bikes. It's clean, never overcrowded and the staff is welcoming & courteous. My Personal Trainer and I meet in between kick boxing and Brazilian Jiu jitsu classes and have the opportunity to work out in private. I highly recommend!

Great group of people, great group of instructors that have a great system setup to help you succeed. Very competitive but friendly environment. Love the experience at paragon. People are mostly friendly and helpful to new comers. There is a lot of different people at different skill level so sparring is very effective. Joined 2 month ago for jiujitsu.

I HIGHLY recommend Paragon Academy.  Honestly, it's the most professional and friendly gym I've ever gone to.

I joined Paragon about two years ago for the kickboxing program,  and my 17 year-old son joined about 1 year ago for both the kickboxing and JiuJitsu programs.   We love it; we both train almost daily.   

The instructors are world class (seriously, check them out),  the facilities are very clean, the training mat is huge and there is a competition-size boxing ring.  In addition, Paragon has a full range of exercise equipment, from heavy bags, Thai pads, gloves, and focus mitts to stationary bikes, free weights, and kettlebells.  

To me, the most impressive aspect of Paragon is the atmosphere and the quality of the instructors and instruction; professional yet very personal. The instructors are very supportive and take a personal interest in each individual student.   Not only are the instructors incredible, the fellow students are also fun, motivational and willing to help.   The workouts are disciplined and most of the students train quite seriously, but we also have a lot of fun.

A couple of special notes:
WOMEN: do not hesitate to try out kickboxing or JiuJitsu; there are many women at Paragon, especially in the kickboxing program
TEENS and PARENTS OF TEENS: the atmosphere at Paragon is incredible; both the instructors and a majority of the students provide great role-models and support; you won't find a more positive environment anywhere
OLDER ATHLETES: I started kickboxing more than two years ago at the age of 49 and, at my age, I worried about injuries.  However, the classes are well taught and safe...after training almost daily for over two years, I do not have any training related injuries.

Obviously, from my review, I love Paragon, but for good reason.  It's like a second home to me and my son.  Come check it out.

Wow! What a workout you get in 20 minutes. 
I didnt believe it until I tried it. Now I'm hooked and feeling better than I have in a long time!!!
Ask for Chelsey. She is great to work with!!!

Good spot to grab a quick workout during the winter time. My wife and I do triathlons and the spring and summer keep us busy outdoors training but love to workout here on bad wether days or winter training.

Great coaches and I love how Olympic lifts are incorporated to the cross fit classes. I just wish I could go every day but work schedule is a beast sometimes. Bonus is that you can access the cross fit or the team lab area (if you're signed up for those) and do the workout 24/7 with fob access.

+ Super knowledgeable trainers and staff 
+ Passionate, friendly people at this gym
+ Top-notch Crossfit 
+ Amazing online resources

I started Crossfit on a whim because of a "why not" moment on Groupon. Why not? Perhaps since I've started, I have never been this sore in my life, nor have I ever had any desire to jump rope until I pee my pants. Why yes? Crossfit at The Lab is FUN. The coaches and your fellow gym rats are PASSIONATE people. They love what they do and it really shows. 

I was hesitant to try Crossfit due to all of the things I heard about how it can cause serious injury (rhabdomyolysis anyone?) due to overtraining and pushing oneself too hard in the name of competition. Not here at The Lab. You go through a 3-class "ramp-up" to get you acquainted with the basics and to guide you through proper form so that you can be familiar with the basic movements before you venture into a regular class. The trainers are so knowledgeable and so invested in helping you achieve your potential - everything from correcting your form to staying late after class to answer your million and one questions. Everyone is kind. No one is judgmental. I have never felt so welcome to a gym, as a newcomer or not. 

It's super inspiring to see people of all levels and expertise training alongside you. Not just because you happen to be a weenie and are benching only 43lbs (including the barbell lol) because it's only your first real-deal post-ramp up class. Ogling the people doing handstand pushups while you are struggling to finish your damn regular pushups is inspiring. At least it is to me. If you're into that kind of thing - seeing what others can achieve and knowing that with some hard work and sweat one day you can get there too.

I just became a member of this place, and I love it so far.  This place is serious about getting you in shape.  There are personal trainers everywhere, so there's no reason for you to not get whipped into shape.  I got 3 free sessions when I joined so I could get on a good program, and they give you the opportunity to get 3 more sessions for $100.

The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because this place is strictly for working out.  There are no tennis courts, racquetball courts, pool, etc.

This place is great. Staff is really friendly and supportive, machines and overall the cleanest gym I have been to in New Orleans. Love the circuit area for an overall timed workout when I run in before work.  Not one of those places [eople come to show off.  Especially like the treadmills with TV's.  I can watch my news shows before work as well.  Locker rooms couldn't  be nicer.  Color choices make you feel comfortable and not antiseptic.

If you are at all serious about getting strong and doing it safely, you should really join war horse. The owners allow me to train there as a powerlifter, so I am usually a fly on the wall between sets watching the private sessions/classes. I go to many gyms and I am always impressed by Chris and Jacqueline's coaching. They really play close attention to ensure that every movement is done correctly and with maximum pay off. Even when sessions are not going on, they are discussing programming and how to optimize each members experience. Also, it is a very welcoming environment; everyone is super friendly and I see all levels of fitness and strength. Lifting weights is intimidating to some people, but Warhorse will show you how awesome it is. Now go get strong!

Back when I lived in T-Town i was here for over a year. One of the best in my life. Had a lot of fun, routes were always changing, it was hard to do all the routes before they set up new ones. 

The lofted bouldering area is also a fun space to re-coop while your arms sizzle down from fiery stumps. The new addition to the space done over a year ago ads a lot more room , because it can get crowded as the most popular indoor gym in Tucson. The rates are good and the staff friendly. I will always visit whenever I'm in town...

Excellent place. I was sort of intimidated by climbing for the first time, but the intro session was very helpful and staff were very friendly. Very fun, great space, and lots of options for all levels (as far as I can tell!).

I love this place! They have a lot of options for climbers of all different abilities. It can get crowded here in the evenings sometimes, especially when they have student/military discounts, but if its not too crowded its great. The staff is really laid back, and its a cool environment.

I've been going for years, and I simply love this place!  I don't know why I haven't written a review before now, it just never crossed my mind.  Where  do I start with a place that has so many good points?  

The staff is amazing!  They are so friendly, nice, and really make the customer feel safe and respected.  They are always there to help rookie climbers, and offer tips to the people who have been climbing for a while.  Regardless if you are renting your equipment from them, or bringing in your own, the staff will treat you with the same respect and courtesy as anyone else.  It is a rare event to see on of the staff without a smile on their face.  

As good as the staff is, the walls are even better.  Rocks and Ropes offers a variety of climbing options for every skill level.  They have flat walls, inclined walls, and simulated rock face walls.  They offer belaying more than one type of belaying, including multiple auto-belayers for those without a partner.  They also have a Free standing boulder, and a secondary bouldering room upstairs. 

They also have a small area upstairs for parties, a store to buy your own rock climbing gear, and showers available for those who might need to head somewhere after working out.  (I even like the music they have playing throughout the building.)  The only thing I wish was different is their hours.  (Who closes at 8:00 PM on a Saturday?!)  But even that isn't enough to detract from the five star rating they obviously deserve!

The best climbing in Tucson.

The climbing routes are varied and have several levels of difficulty. The staff are friendly and do a good job of changing up the routes regularly. There are a few auto-belay devices, which are great for an afternoon if you show up without a partner.

You can save a little money if you bring your own equipment, but the rental prices are reasonable even if you don't own a thing.

I've been going to Rocks and Ropes consistently for over a month now and have been going inconsistently for years and I absolutely love it! It's a great workout and tons of fun. The staff is helpful and it's pretty clean considering. The only downside is that it is expensive. Especially if you plan on going frequently. But I feel it's easily worth the money. They are constantly changing the different climbs available but have enough walls so that they remain available for quite some time. Also, they offer a good amount of bouldering and 4 auto-belays.

These days so many people are on a fitness craze. It seems like everyone I know (and their mother) are gym members or do some crazy boot camp.  As a tried and true member of the 'sit on the couch and watch movies' crowd, Rocks and Ropes has been a fun and interesting place to trick myself into a 'workout'. 

I love that each time I come there's a mix of new and old routes. It's great being able to really see my progress (finally got up a 7+!) as well as have something new to try out.  They rate their climbs on a tally system where everyone who climbs a new route can rate it, which is great, but leads to a bit of variation between similarly rated routes. It still makes for a great workout though and you can push yourself to try something a little more difficult each time. 

After coming here a couple times, my boyfriend and I sprung for the punchcard deal where you get 10 anytime entries + rental. They also have monthly memberships with discounted student, military and family/couple rates as well as a 2-for-1 beginner package for 30 dollars which includes rental and an intro class to climbing for two people.

This place is great. An indoor place to climb where you can rent shoes and practice? Too fun.  Although I didn't spend any time climbing due to an ankle injury, I was able to watch everyone else and it was definitely a learning experience.  The workers take the time to explain all the ins and outs of climbing and safety precautions.  They won't let people climb until they demonstrate they know what they're doing.  There are a few tables upstairs that can be used for parties.  In fact, when we were there, they were set up for various birthday parties with decorations and pizza/cake, which seemed to be the popular choice.  Definitely worth the cost to rent/climb.

This gym is kind of crap. Most people know that planet fitness isn't an actual gym since they don't even have squat racks because their members get intimidated. That's right if a member thinks something is too hard, they get rid of it. Gold star for everyone as long as you make it into the gym. 

But past all that the staff at this location is rude. Super unprofessional, they don't actually know the machines that they have there and they talk crap on the members. Yep, in the "no judgement zone" of planet fitness the employees judge their members. 

Anyway. If you're serious about fitness find a real gym.
Like University of New Orleans engineering better. No discount for first responders. You have to wait in line for a time limit on a machine because everyone is hogging up their time.

I love the reily center because I will always associate it with my transition from evening to early morning workouts. My experience with reily has been limited mostly to that time slot, so I've been able to miss the preening dude bros for the most part. The weight room is pretty extensive, and the cardio section is good. They also has great basketball, pool and studio class offerings. The only negative is the locker room, as the keypad locks sometimes malfunction. However, the sauna is a nice addition. This is a great option for people living in the area that are not associated with the university.
Taking the gym spa experience to the next level. Great for families with young kids.  Tailored personal training

We belong to lifetime in another state and were visitingvisiting from Colorado to buy a potential second-home in the area. First Jen The front desk person was so nice and very helpful.   She speaks so highly of the club and all of the amenities that it offers.    I also met Joe the general manager what a terrific guy.     The club is much smaller than other lifetimes however very full service for those who want The next level and service.    The bathrooms are fantastic and for the men fully stocked with shavers, shaving cream and lotions.   You need absolutely no toiletries all provided.  Great location next to the mall.  Highly recommend.

This was the nicest Lifetime I've ever been to (I've visited all of them in Illinois and Indiana - one in Georgia Ohio Louisiana Michigan) Samantha helped me find the building on the phone before I came, greeted me when I entered, and even asked about me when I was leaving. Highly recommend. A gem.

This gym is unlike any other in Tampa.  I have a membership to LA Fitness (old LifeStyles) and hands down this is the best gym.  I have been going for 18 months and have dropped my bodyfat from 29.9% to 13.8%.  From Pilates, to yoga, to personal training, I have enjoyed every bit of my time there.  Yes it is not your normal Tampa gym, but the service, the staff and all the amenities are fantastic when compared to the other gyms I have been to in Tampa.  I have made it my daily destination for myself and it has paid off greatly.  I love working out there as the bathrooms are clean, the gym doesn't smell and the equipment is taken care of in spades compared to the other two gyms I visit in town.  I will admit, this gym is not for everyone, but it is amazing for me.

This is seriously the best gym I have ever been to. It is also a physical therapy center and is located in a medical facility complex. There is always ample parking and doesn't get too busy. Max of maybe 30 people at once, usually. There is never a wait on equipment. They don't have a decline bench, which stinks, but they do have a decline sit up bench that can be used as a decline bench for bench press. The facility offers a "women-only" room that has all the machines you need, and also has some free weights, a bike and a treadmill. There is a 25m pool with three lanes, a jacuzzi and a relaxation pool that is kept at about 96 degrees. There is also a dry sauna and the showers have shampoo/conditioner/body wash/lotion and the gym provides both hand towels, as well as shower towels, and blow dryers. I am very satisfied with this gym and the price is reasonable, at about $50 a month. It's worth every penny !
Went here while we were in town for my bachelorette party.  Similar setup as Orange Theory, you'll leave sweating for sure.  High end gym with a smoothie bar and fully stocked bathroom.

I recently graduated from being a short sprinter in college in May and was looking for the perfect fitness facility to give me a hard cardio and resistance training workout. I also studied exercise science and therefore have a very picky attitude towards fitness facilities. However Barry's Boot Camp is the best around! The instructors are amazing and the workouts will kick your butt. Not to mention that the shower facilities are amazing and that there is a protein smoothie bar there as well. I'm extremely happy and pleased to be a member of Barrys Boot Camp and wish that everyone could give it a try. Antonio is amazing

Great place for a workout.   I was in town for 5 days and went here for three of those five as you can purchase a buy two classes get one free as a new person.  Had a different coach each class that had very different styles of workouts so you're never going to be bored.  However I'd like to see more stretching at the end overall a fantastic workout.

I just got back into working out and so I was a little worried after reading some reviews that I could actually make it through a class without embarrassing myself. 

I messaged Devin on Facebook and he reassured me that I'd be okay, he even offered to cover my first class! That made me feel so much better and not to mention I felt like the trainers already cared before I even gave them my business. 

Wonderful. Best workout of my life and I will definitely be back for more. Thank you Devin!!!

Great workout great employees! Was here for work and dropped into a class they were extremely welcoming and explained the entire class to be prior as it was my first time participating in a Barry's class! Got a great sweat in and made sure to grab a delicious shake on my way out!

I went in for my first class last night. The workout was great, and the instructor Matt was awesome. However, the blonde girl working at the front desk (I don't know her name) was so rude and unwelcoming. You would think a gym would go out of their way to be polite to all of their patrons, especially first-timers.

Barry's is awesome!  Instructors are really nice and energetic, Antonio's the best!  I really like the Wednesday Chest & Back class.  Very clean, showers, and great products.  Do not need a lock for the lockers, super easy.  Playlist is great too.

Barry's Bootcamp will kick your ass. If you are serious about amping up your workout, this is your spot. Move past the model pictures on the wall and the loud music. Challenge yourself. Trainers here are great. Facility is nice and there is plenty of parking. I hit the early morning classes 3X  a week. Commit and you will see results. And, quit whining. It's all about what you are willing to do for yourself. Barry's will help you get there! I'm a fan. And, did I mention, I'm almost 47 years old? Get after it...

I love Barry's and I am so happy Nashville has one! 

Classes are rarely packed and there is a parking lot across the street that offers free one hour parking making it easy to get in/out of downtown. 

There's a fab smoothie bar (PB+J with Kale) is my favorite and you can order ahead of time so your smoothie is ready and waiting for you after class. 

Anne Marie is my favorite instructor!

Fantastic personal training for women. Classes offered for every fitness level. This is not a traditional gym. The trainers work with you to find the right class placement. The classes are unique, interesting and different every time. It never gets boring. They offer yoga, TRX, boxing, Surfset, Lift and Cardio. It's a true community of women trying to get better every day. Everyone is supportive and encouraging. Recommend for anyone wanting to feel empowered and get fit.
Very pricey!  Disappointed in the number of people in the classes (sometimes 12) given the small environment and limited equipment.  People are nice, but it's just not worth the money.
Beautiful new gym the equipment is state of the art. In an ideal location near the Mall and Costco and Wegmans

The equipment is so old and so felty! I just upgraded to a multi club membership so I can come to the la fitness close to work ( east Norritown) and it was just not worthy!!! This la fitness just sucks!!!!

Like other reviewers, I also drive 15 min out of my way to go to this location instead of the one in KOP. I won't risk getting a staph infection by going to the nasty LA Fitness in KOP. As a result, this location is massively overcrowded-- especially the pool. There are several elderly people who hog all the pool lanes to just float around for hours on end; the management seriously needs to do something about this so people who want to use the pool to actually swim laps can. Also, the trainers tend to circle you like vultures. I actually took the time to listen to their sales pitch and the training sessions are massively overpriced. On the plus side, they have a decent variety of classes, the facility is newly updated and clean, and the monthly fees are reasonable.

i've been a member of this gym for a couple of weeks now, and i'm enjoying it.  conveniently located, very reasonably priced, and all the basic amenities -- plenty of cardio machines, plenty of weights, a lap pool, a spin class room, and a big aerobics studio.  the staff are all really nice as well, and you get a free personal trainer session when you sign up.  and your membership fee allows you to use all of their area locations for no extra money.  and if you have kids (i don't), they offer babysitting for limited hours.

the only things i'm a bit bummed about are:  1. they don't open until 8am on the weekends (i'm an early riser and would prefer to go a bit earlier than that), and 2. the only group fitness class they offer before work is a 5:45am spin class (i'm sorry, i just can't do spin that early in the morning).

this isn't the gym for you if you want all sorts of foo-foo stuff like a smoothie bar and massage and lots of high-tech equipment.  but if you just want a place to come and work out with nice people on good equipment, then you'll save some money by joining LA fitness.
It's a clean gym, with an ok vibe, the locker rooms are large and clean, and the staff is cool and helpful.

First off  there's the issue of cancelled classes that plagues both this LA Fitness and Montgomeryville: classes are constantly cancelled, if you're lucky there's a sub but half the time you show up and no one is there.  I specifically pay $30 a month FOR PILATES AND YOGA CLASSES--so if the only evening classes offered within a 10-15 mile radius of where I work/live are always cancelled or rescheduled to Zumba or something high impact that hurts my joints it wastes my time and gas money in getting to the gym to find this out.

Bringing me to reason 1 of why this location in particular sucks: front desk staff are particularly rude and completely unknowledgeable.  So I asked to speak to a manager about the pilates class situation and got some guy "specifically brought in to help that location."  He took down my info and offered to call me back with answers within 24 hours.  3 days later I call back and it's like we never even talked, he has no memory of offering to call me back and all he can tell me is that "the activities person was in today working."  Great so does that mean she fixed the pilates class situation? "I don't know" was my response.    

On top of all that this location always appears dirty and dingy, the air conditioning in the room where classes are held does not work, and there's an infernal "beeping" all throughout the classes and all the instructors say they don't know how to make it stop (it's really distracting during something like yoga where otherwise the room is silent).  It's always crowded, hard to park, and the locker room is filthy compared to every other location.  Also I hate how all the machines are close together and stuffed into one level--it's just a very poorly designed space and it makes the chore of working out even less appealing.
