This location is by far the worst of the 5 LA Fitnesses I've been to (including Montgomeryville, Fort Washington, Downingtown, and West Chester).  Sadly it's by far the closest one to where I live of course.  Which makes me wonder why they won't open a location in Lansdale...

I was a member here many years ago (ok, five), and at the time I really enjoyed it. I was in shape and stayed in shape. Fast forward a few years (and many beers), and I have moved away and come back...both to Blue Bell and this gym. I have to re-climb the mountain, but in spite of my humbling I do enjoy this location quite a bit. Not the best gym of which I've ever been a member, but it is quite nice, rather cheap, and free of most sorts of BS. That is all I want.

They have plenty of Hammer Strength machines, and enough cardio stations during peak hours so you aren't standing around for minutes at a time not doing anything. Sure, the Devon Fitness Club beats this place for opulence (flat screen TV on every machine, anyone?), but this joint is far cheaper, so its a tradeoff. I have quite the beergut to remove but I don't feel out of place here, and that is all I wanted/needed. Just wish the music was better but I say that everywhere I go.

I was a member here for way too long, when there were other gyms more deserving of my money. Machines are often dirty and not kept in good repair (ex rips in the vinyl armpads). The members are more to blame, as I see people sweat up equipment and not wipe it down. I avoided this place at all costs during flu season for fear of catching something. The staff has zero b*lls and won't tell the cardio hogs they've exceeded the 30min usage time when there are people waiting. 

On a positive note, there were several great instructors for the cycle and kickboxing classes, some who have been there 5+ yrs. 

You get what you pay for, so if you want a gym that feels like Walmart, join this one. If you want Target level or better, seek out the other, slightly pricier, options.
This is definitely my favorite one so far out of all the LA Fitness locations I've been to....friendly helpful staff, equipment is always where it belongs, always paper towels and soap.

its the power breathing , half crunches & horizontal bicycles in the sauna that make me uncomfortable.

a quick schwitz & it's off to see the judge.

the guy in the sauna just told me that allied  barton is going to be laying off a bunch of employees. I said what's that ?

every guy in here should have andy reids job. jesus the pain

needed a sauna badly. Struggling.

Don't usually admit being a patron but today is my swimming day.

The reason this place gets 3 stars, is because of their Kickbox Cardio, Total Body Work and Abs, Zumba, and Spin Class instructors!
These ladies rock, and make it worth coming here!
Besides that, there are a lot of rude members here, taking a lot of the equipment and areas to themselves simultaneously, not wiping sweat off of benches and seats after they use it. At least half of the clientale here have no manners or class. 
The staff isn't that friendly here either.
If they lose their Class Instructors, I'm out of here.

The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because I got the SWEET black Friday special when I rolled in the day after eating 10 casserole dishes of stuffing and drinking about 5 bottles of wine on T-giving.  Let me just say that I have never paid so little for a gym membership in my life.  

All that said, this place at times is a seedy, Jersey-shore-esque meat market of a gym.  The place is crawling with guidos every time I've been.  I tend to go after work because my bed has a special dark magic that won't let me leave it until after 7 a.m., and let me tell you: IT IS CROWDED AS SHIT BETWEEN 5:30 and 8:00 p.m.  Don't even bother trying to find a parking spot in the main parking area behind the building - just park somewhere out front and walk. You may save yourself 5 minutes or so.  While there is always plenty of cario equipment to be had, traversing the gym floor can be like being at the mall on Christmas Eve - there are people everywhere.  For each nautilus machine, there are at least 2 dudes spotting each other, slobbering over chicks on the cardio machines, and generally d*cking off. Ew!  I am also totally creeped out by the CO-ED sauna and steam room that lie in the seedy netherworld of a hallway between the mens' and ladies' locker rooms.  I think if I ever went back there, I'd bring some mace, some Lysol, and maybe a billy club.  Of course, given the crowd over there, that may or may not be a turn on.

It's not as crowded on the weekends, and I assume that it's just fine in the early morning hours.  I'll be sure to update this review if I am ever unable to un-hex my boudoir.

I rarely write review but this is truly worthy of this sit down and write. The review by Rudi P below does NOT reflect how her other students feel. 

I began training with Lorelei roughly one year ago having been injured and out of shape. I had trained briefly in aerial at an amateur level but since the injuries I  was very nervous of climbing back up. Since then I have gained strength and balance, increased my flexibility and am encouraged always to climb higher than my expectations. 

I am friends with other students of hers and none of them have said these things regarding her teaching. Lorelei has treated my health and fitness in her gym as sacred and has worked continuously with me being supportive and encouraging.

Also, she really is FUN. I work my butt off there and laugh and sweat the entire time. Please take what that reviewer said with a grain of salt, some people are just difficult to make happy.

Thank you Lorelei for all your work with me!!

I have trained at the world famous Cirque School LA, where from Lorelei was highly recommended to me and they were beyond truthful!

It's nice that this location has a bunch of equipment, but unfortunately the space is too small for everything. Plus the equipment is a bit dated. Everything appeared to be in decent shape but there are some cramped spots, especially if trying to use the squat rack right by the dumbbells. I was able to get a decent workout in while on the road, but there are better Anytime Fitness locations out there.
Love it!  Great weightlifting gym in downtown STL.  I travel here from out of town and this is walking distance to the main hotels and the drop in fee is cheap!

So I love this gym. The entire 2 years that I was a member I loved it because it fit my needs exactly. I have since cancelled my membership due to leaving for work nowadays at 530 am leaves me little time to actually go but I am hoping one of these days my work schedule changes and I can start going again. My favorite part would have to be the large amount of cardio equipment that was usually readily available and the usual staff I encountered was always incredibly friendly. When I made the decision that I needed to cancel I was a little nervous because I am insanely non confrontational but the process was smoother than I could have asked for. Within an hour of sending my email through the website I had an email back from the manager and I really respect that. I would have to say the only thing I wish was different about the place would be the hours. I have a long commute and having them open earlier (or later) would be very beneficial.

I am incredibly impressed with the fitness factory. I live downtown and work in the county and it is so nice to work out in the morning and then shower in a nice, clean shower before heading off to work. The machines and showers are never crowded and I am always able to get my workout/shower in and get to work in earth city by 8. I can not speak for the evening hours because my workout time is always in the am but the morning staff is evry friendly and the lady behind the desk is constantly folding new towels, cleaning, etc. I have tried quite a few gyms but have never felt as comfortable working out at one.

What a great workout at RowZone! It's not just 45 minutes of sitting on a Row Machine but 45 minutes of non stop rowing intervals mixed with core and weight circuits. The staff is thorough, friendly and fun and you really get  personal attention and motivation. You'll walk away feeling that good kinda burn! I can't wait to hit up my next class!

I've been going here for a few months and I have to say, I love it. I feel like I'm getting a better workout than other things I've tried and as far as workouts go, it's fun. Laura is by far the best - she mixes things up well by changing exercises often throughout and targeting different body parts on different days, plus she's encouraging without being annoying. I just wish they had more space in their morning classes!

Best workout for your entire body! Every instructor is amazing and they all push you in different ways, so tons of variety. Each instructor has their own unique style, music, etc so you can never get bored. This workout is no joke, you will sweat& workout every muscle in your body! As far as the studio goes, the location can not be beat. It's on the 2nd floor but no windows. But Trust me that does not matter because your eyes are glued on the instructor the entire class for direction, pace& power. I love how the studio is well lit, bright and clean. They maintain it impeccably. Whether you are out of shape or a gym junkie, this studio will certainly push you!

Today marked the end of my first month of rowing at RowZone. I could not be more happy with my experience thus far. At my first class, I met with the instructor, Laura, who spent time going over the ERG machine with me and showing me proper rowing form. She continued to check in with me throughout the class to see how I was doing and kept me motivated to keep pushing myself. 

While I have not taken classes from all of the instructors at RowZone, from my experience I can tell you that Laura is phenomenal. She structures her classes to be a mixture of rowing and strength training, with five 5-minute sets of rowing and a "break" of weight/resistance band training in between each set.

It's a tough workout, especially when Laura throws sprints into the mix, but that's why you're going, right? In one month I have lost 8 lbs and can notice considerably more muscle definition in my shoulders, arms and legs. In addition to great classes, the trainers are happy to share advice on other fitness topics from nutrition to exercises you can do at home. The online scheduler RowZone uses makes it easy to find classes that fit into your schedule, just be sure to be considerate and don't cancel at the last minute or fail to show up at all as there can sometimes be a wait list of other rowers who would like to get in the class.

One last point I'd like to make is the sense of community that RowZone fosters. While the quality of your workout is ultimately up to you, the support you receive from your peers is immensely valuable. When you feel like there's no way your legs can push you through those last 5 minutes of rowing, all you have to do is look to a neighbor for motivation to keep going.

The place is a smaller facility but I really get my workout in.

Depending on which instructor it is, the circuit training may vary but the music always keeps me going as well as the variety in circuits. 

They take walk-ins but I just sign up via Classpass.

Make sure to bring $1 since towels are not complimentary.

I try to work a RowZone class at least once a week. 

I highly suggest trying it out if you want to add variety to your workout regimen.

Plus the music is a great variety that will keep you pumped especially for those who enjoy hip hop.

I was sort of unsure how to rate this place. I had a similar experience to Sara P. 
I joined in October. Got a GREAT workout. It was really enjoyable and definitely challenging. In December, emails about fraud, theft, employees leaving started coming.  My husband and I had purchased, but didn't get to use yet, 10 classes each for $85.  The new owners wouldn't recognize the 10 classes, but we can each have $85 credit. I was told we had till the end of Feb to covert the credit to classes but the owner said I may want to wait, as she offers specials in February. 
I email this week about a deal they have for 5 classes for $47. I get an email back that I can't use the credits for special deals.  What???
I just want to use my credits, and walk away. It doesn't seem to me that this place is fixed at all.
There are plenty of places in Philadelphia where I can work out and not have to worry about all this drama.
The workout is a 4-5 star. The ethics is a 1.

RowZone is a full body workout that is highly effective and never boring. Cardio on the ERG, weights and AB exercises make it the most efficient 45 minute workout I have ever done. And, the instructors (Laura in particular) are all professional and motivational. It feels like personalized instruction!

3.5! I do really enjoy going to Rowzone, but I feel like the instructors vary.
Some instructors are really great and adjust you when your form is off. Some instructors just go through the class and don't really pay attention. I've definitely had times where I had a sore back the next day because my form was way off. I'm still getting use to the rowing technique and I wish that the instructor had paid attention. I know the classes can get full so it's hard, but I must have been doing it all wrong.
I like the mix of rowing a few minutes and then working out (like sit ups, push ups, and etc.) a few minutes. The arm blasts work outs are my favorite. 
Facility is clean. Everyone is easy going. It's a good workout.

Found this box on yelp and went in to check it out. I met Zack and he was great! I explained My wife and I were drop ins, only in town for a couple days.  Zack was more than accommodating.  
We came in the next morning for a WOD and Zack was a great coach, made us feel at home and we got a great workout in. My only problem was I forgot about the elevation difference and that added to my fatigue.  
Anyways, great box, great people. I highly recommend this box and wish Zack and his crew nothing but success!  I will come here anytime I am back in town!

If your looking for a box while your in Reno this place is great.  Welcomed me and my daughter with open arms very inviting and reasonably priced.  Good equipment and very knowledgeable staff.  5 stars all the the way!!!!

This was a nice facility, the coaches and members were very welcoming. Zack was very attentive to everyone in the class and made sure everyone was on the same page as well as performing movements in a safe and correct manner. A great place for CrossFit! I was really satisfied with this gym. Thank you CrossFit Regulus!

After a bad experience at another PF in town, I was very impressed with the customer service of this location. On my first day, I asked if I could buy a lock for the locker room. The guy at the counter goes, "Oh, we don't make you do that here. Let me show you...."  He takes me over to some lockers and shows me that all I have to do is put a combination of my choice in the lock and I'm good to go. No hassle. He saved me some money and the hassle of having to remember another combination. Thank you!!! He also answered some other newbie questions for me and couldn't have been more friendly. My experience with the other employees thus far have been nothing but stellar. They've been joyous, courteous and helpful. Thanks guys!

Planet fitness, specifically the one on Murfreesboro Rd in franklin, is fantastic! Being a fitness junkie and having spent many years in every gym known to man, as well as being a personal trainer for about a decade, planet fitness is refreshing. I don't have the same need to go workout for 3 hours a day and stare in the mirror at my progress and compare myself to what I looked like a month ago, and to the other people around me. And Planet Fitness caters to that. It's so clean and well maintained. The staff is super friendly and i truly believe the laid back atmosphere that  encourages you to come do your own thing when it's convenient for you is because of the attitude generated by employees.  The locker rooms are great. Never had a complaint and I LOVE the black card member benefits!

Its pretty empty but the facility seems clean and its very new.  Everything was very simple to use and it was a convenient, quick experience.  The employee could have been friendlier, but there weren't any issues.
I workout here 5 days a week, and love it!  The staff is friendly,  the place is immaculate,  the equipment is in excellent shape.
Very impressed with the equipment here! On top of that, it is clean and the staff is very friendly!

Solid little spinning studio in center city Philly.

Highlights:
First class is free. And subsequent classes are not expensive, as far as spinning studios go. 
Instructors are very supportive and go out of their way to help newbies. 
The class I took with Russell was a very tradition spin class...no weights or crazy dance moves on the bike...and it was solid. He comes out into the crowd to ride on empty bikes next to class participants which is super cool. 
Good music. I know some people mention in their reviews that it's loud but I found it actually quieter than I'm used to. 
Sign up, reservation, and check-in process was super easy

What to know:
This studio is not dark. This was strange for me and I realize now I prefer spinning in a dark studio. If you want closer to dark, sit in the back row along the back wall of the studio and not under the skylight or by the windows. 
The spin bikes are ones I've used with a trainer but not in a studio before. They were fine but there's not a summary at the end of the ride of your watts/MPH which I'm used to seeing right on the console. 
There's one bathroom with one shower. Plan to shower elsewhere. 

Overall, I really liked my class at Body Cycle. When I'm in Philly on business again, it'll definitely be my go to.

I really loved the energy during my first class here last week. It was a 60 minute ride. The instructors were on their A game. The music was perfect. And being that it was my first ride, it was free (YAY!). Everyone was super friendly and helpful, and now I can tell with Shoshana's classes always book up so quickly. She rocks.

Another 5-star review, another drop in the 5-star bucket for Body Cycle. It's not easy finding a cycling studio with a fun vibe, good energy, perfect music, and psychopa...I mean, intensely passionate instructors. Shoshana, Russell, Jesse, Jessica, to just name the few I frequented, are the crème de la crème, baby.

Not to mention, compared to most other cycling studios, you get major bang for your buck, especially if you buy classes in bulk, or get in on the various deals they have throughout the year. 

Also, your first class is free, which is totally sweet. Stop pinching your muffin top and check these guys out already!

Amazing place. Business is run with customer in mind - I once got sick and had to cancel less than 24-hours, they honored that given my condition. They could have been difficult about it, but this place actually cares about customers as individuals, and not a source of profit. Very clean, amazing instructors.

(to the tune of T. Swift's classic, "22")

It feels like the perfect place to don some leggings
and destroy our hamstrings (uh uh, uh uh)
It feels like the perfect place to wake up with the sun
and to get our spin on (uh uh, uh uh)

Yeah.... we're sweaty, drenched, and energized at the same time 
It's miserable and magical
oh yeah.... BodyCycle's the place where we forget about the outside
It's time

Uh oh.
I don't know about you
But I'm feeling sweaty, WOO
Everything will be alright 
If you just stay on your bike! 
You don't know about me
And isn't that the best thing
Everything will be alright 
If we just stay on our bikes getting
Sweaty WOO (ooh ooh)
Sweaty WOO! (ooh ooh)

So, I'll go ahead and say that this is NOT my number one favorite spin studio, but it is a fairly close second. Super convenient location (for me), love their generosity with the towels, and the space is pretty fantastic. Sometimes during the daytime hours (read: suns out, guns out) the lighting is a little brighter than is ideal for my "perfect" spin class (I love a dark studio, music bumping). They've got a skylight that allows a lotta natural light (but hey, some folks are into that!) ClassPass gives me three classes a month, and while I rarely use them all, I feel super lucky that I've got em! Lots of class times, and hype instructors.

I've taken a lot of spin classes over the years, and nothing compares to the classes at Body Cycle. From the nice, clean space and amazing bikes, to the welcoming and motivating instructors, every class is a top notch work out.

For anyone who struggles to fit workouts in, the online scheduling system makes it easy to plan ahead (and there's no need to line up way in advanced like many gyms make you do).

There is no way I can write this review without giving Russell, the owner of Body Cycle, a shout out. Russell's passion for fitness and cycling is so evident, as is his desire for all of his clients to succeed. He is always dropping in to classes to check in/provide encouragement, and is open to ideas and recommendations from anyone. Russell always wears a smile on his face, even when he's kicking your butt in class!

I simply love Body Cycle Studio.  My body may not agree (especially at 8:30am) but I figure it'll appreciate my efforts when it's toned and fit.

The instructors are all friendly and supportive.  If you're really looking for a sweaty workout, try Shoshanna's (if you can reserve a spot... she's very popular!). She's full of energy and always has a playlist I'm dying to steal.  Even amateurs can jump right in since the workouts can be adapted to any level.

The owner, Russell Carter, is amazing and should win an award for customer service.  When he's teaching a class, you know he's working out just as hard as you are!  He's also constantly stopping by to make sure that everyone's bikes are properly adjusted.  He genuinely seems to care about everyone's welfare and pushes you hard but never beyond your own limits. 

First class is free so there's no excuse not to get off your butt and get on a bike!

OMG - GO HERE.  I've taken spinning classes at a number of places, both in the city and elsewhere.  I've never been anywhere as amazing as Body Cycle.  Here's what you WON'T see:  broken bikes, out of towels, classes cancelled at the last minute, instructors getting subs you don't like at the last minute, stupid rules about how to sign up for a class, instructors half assing a class, or any kind of mess.  If the owner's goal was to find the very best instructors in the city and bring them all to one place, he has succeeded.  I love Monica, Rebecca, Russell, Barry and Erik, but I have no doubt the other instructors are crazy good as well.  These classes are well planned, and they are no joke.  The bikes are amazing.  The space is beautiful.  There isn't just a water cooler, but one that lets you choose the temperature of your water.  This place is nicer than my home.  And I feel as welcome here as I do in my home.  The instructors are always friendly and welcoming, and always helping people set up their bikes if they're new to the studio.  The patrons are lovely as well.  No weird cliques, no one judging you or making you feel out of place.  You sign up for your classes on line, and can do so up to two weeks in advance.  They have an app so you can accomplish this right on your phone.  The more classes you buy at once, the lower the price.  Also, your first ride is free, so check it out.  I have zero doubt you'll be glad you did.

Love BCS! Signing up for classes on their website was easy. The front desk staff was friendly and energetic. The instructor was very nice and helped everyone get their bike adjusted appropriately before the class. Great workout. Definitely felt the burn.
Love this Place! The instructors actually care about their clients. Great Customer Service!

I am in town from Denver and looked on Yelp for a spinning class with a shower and found this gem! Super friendly staff who helped me snag the last seat in a full class. Russell was the instructor and he was fantastic. I really liked that the resistance and revs were numerically monitored so I could always be sure I was at the right pace and resistance, and this couldn't slack off the way one could in other kinds of spinning classes where resistance and pace is more relative and self-measured.

I'm in love. This is a great fitness studio, everything is always clean and working properly. I've been a client on and off  for the last few years, and they have made great changes recently to make the studio even better than it was.

Wow what a workout. I had Maria but it was her last class, so I can't speak for the rest of the instructors, but she was great. It was my first free intro class, and it did not disappoint. I also loved the bikes since they show RPM and you can really push yourself versus the standard bikes. The place is a little hard to find and is on a second floor of a row home. It's quite pricey, so I don't think I would get a full membership since I like having variety of classes to pick from, but for any spinning enthusiasts this is a great gym!

I use body cycle as part of my ClassPass.

This place is good for the beginner to mid-level spinners. 

However, if you are trying to get a hard workout in, I'd suggest Flywheel.

The instructors and staff are friendly and helpful especially when you first start out.

The equipment at BC is a bit dated as well as the sound system. I'm a spinner that really gets going based on the bass.

First I'll say that I definitely get a good work out here.  I just moved into center city from the suburbs and I've regularly attended spin classes 4-5 days a week for the past year.  I didn't want to join a gym right away down here with the nice weather approaching so when I heard about this place I thought it would be perfect.
The room is very small for the amount of bikes, so you are kind of on top of each other, which kind of grosses me out when everyone is sweating profusely and breathing heavily.  The bikes are also very different than any other spin bike I've ever seen.  This isn't a bad thing.  I do like the power meter on there, because usually I'm just guessing at my speed and resistance level.  
The online reservation system is nice too, but I've had a hard time getting a spot in a lot of the classes even signing up a week in advance.  I guess that's a testament to how well this place is doing, but its a little frustrating.  
All in all, I think its a great class, just wish the studio was bigger and there were more classes available.

This spinning studio is amazing! I have attended their spin classes regularly since January and still love every class that i go to!

As mentioned in other reviews of the studio, the facility is amazing... Kept immaculately clean and with a great ambiance, you can't help but fall in love with the vibe of the studio. On top of the amazing location, wonderful decoration, and the best spin bikes ever (they have magnetic traction with an awesome screen that helps you track your RPM as well as resistance) the instructors at this studio are wonderful.

I have taken other spin classes and never fallen in love with the workout until I started at body cycle. The instructors (especially the awesome owner, Russel Carter) take time to learn the names of the students and really provide a personal experience that pushes you to your limit at every workout.

I have brought many of my friends with me to the studio because I honestly cannot rave about it enough... My family even visited from out of town last week and I included one of Russel's spin classes as part of their Philly tour!

Love this place!!!

While Body Cycle may not have the pizazz of FlyWheel, I'm a traditionalist and prefer the style here. The staff and instructor made me feel welcome and showed me the proper way to setup my bike to fit my body. The studio was clean and bright and I will definitely be back! Shoutout to Ross for a great class; I burned over 550 calories!
Saturday A.M. 90 minute ride was a great way to start the day! They have cubbies, no locks, one shower, you can refill your water bottle during class.

Great location, great classes!  Robby is my favorite and he is going to be one of the celebrity instructors for the huge indoor spinning event happening this fall called SPINTENSITY 200. Check out the commercial:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_nt79LEaIAM&feature=youtu.be

Love...LOVE Body Cycle.  Best spin classes, hands down.  I've been going to Body Cycle for at least once a week for about a year and I don't intend to stop any time soon.  The teachers make you feel really comfortable and want to make sure you're getting the best experience possible (plus they will actually get to know your name...totally unbelievable if you've ever been to other gyms around the city).

The classes are really kick-ass and you feel like you're about to pass out after, in a good way.  I normally go to Shoshanna or Jess, and they are both AMAZING. Sign up early or you won't get a spot. Best music playlists that are constantly changing (so you won't get bored).  It's not an intimidating environment either, and the instructors will always take the time to show new-comers the right way to position your bike and more.  

First ride free for newbies, and it will be awesome!

I took my first spin class last Saturday (the first is FREE!), and have fallen in love. I have never sweat so much in my life. I felt great afterwards. The instructor (I believe it was Jessica) was very sweet and motivating. She helped my friend and I adjust our bikes before class started, and really helped me push myself. I'm going to start going twice a week, it was AWESOME

This studio is beyond awesome. The staff are really nice and welcoming. The place is clean and provides towels upon check-in. 
You can sign-up for classes on-line and there are plenty of classes at reasonable times. 

If you are new or wanting to try cycling, the instructors are great in making sure proper bike setup and safety.  The classes are fun and challenging. You want that push and these classes provide that result.

Give this place a try and remember why you went to try out and that is to work hard.
Been spinning for over 3 years here! Such a great, fun workout. Each instructor has their own take on a workout, and I have enjoyed all classes I have taken! Shosh is my fav instructor!

I had been a member here for a number of years but recently quit. The Y has basically ruined a gym that was close to my work and now have to drive out of my way to go to a gym. The prior owners of this gym which was called Level Five Fitness were better running a gym.  For starters.. the spinning classes here at the Great Valley Y have been cut to only two classes per week. They also don't unlock the doors to the fitness studios until the instructors show up usually late. So yo have to waste your time waiting for them. I also find the staff here snobby or just talking among themselves and never once look at you or say hello.  I also fine that their mentoring program for kids is more important than the actual paying members. They let the kids on the machines and take up valuable work out time from paying members These kids are just playing on the equipment and the "mentors'' are never really around.  Its shame they have ruined a gym that is so convenient to so many. The paying memberships have declined drastically after the Y took this place over. I felt like I was one of the last ones still going there from the 7 years I had gone there.  So, if you want annoying non-paying kids around you and very scarce classes this is the place for you.

For as cheap as it is, it's good enough. The locker rooms are surprisingly clean, and I've never had to wait for a machine, even at peak hours. But I absolutely agree with all of the comments about the staff. They could at least pretend to not hate their lives. Also, kudos for being open during all of the snowstorms this year.

New owners bring true pride of ownership.  The place is small but had pretty much all you need.  If you are looking for a small, less busy, no screaming muscle monsters, check out this place.  Open 24 hrs.  Price is about $30/ month.  I will never go back to LA Fitness.  


New owner Mike is fantastic.  He just painted the inside and front of the building himself.  The place is meticulous and he is friendly and knowledgeable.  You just can't beat what you get for the money.  Plus, it's open all the time for members.   Now we that is convenient!

I've only been going for 2 months, but my wife has been going for over a year. She loves it and I finally decided to try it out (after not having worked out for nearly 10 years--no joke). There are great trainers who are so impressive in their athletic abilities that it's easy to be in awe of them--but they are so personable and down to earth that they really make you feel like they want to help you on your fitness journey.

I like the format of the varied classes. You know you're in for a hard workout no matter what you choose. There's good music and before you know it, the hour is done and you've undoubtedly burned a ton of calories, cleansed your body of toxins, and sweated through all over.

I've taken boot camp, spin classes, hiit, tone, strength, tabata, and their afterburn classes. My goal was to be going 2-3 times a week, but I've found myself going 5-6 times because the classes are so addictive, easy to schedule, and fun. 

I definitely recommend it.

I have been coming to TZ for almost three years! It continues to add a variety of classes and constantly adapts to challenge even the regulars. There are classes as early as 5am to fit anybody's schedule. I have taken classes at multiple gyms and this one has provided the best experience. There are classes that cater to everybody's fitness level and the instructors are approachable. The owners Scott and Leslie are always quick to respond to questions and concern via email. My favorite classes are boot camp and afterburn. If you are a fitness enthusiast, TZ is more than worth the money.

My wife and I recently moved to the area, and we are self proclaimed fitness fanatics, so the first order of business was to find a gym. First off, this is a locally owned fitness center, not some nationwide globo-gym, so temper your misguided ideas that you need every machine under the sun to get a good workout. My wife and I have had countless gym memberships, and we compete in powerlifting competitions, so I like to think we are good judges when it comes to gyms. This place is the best place in town, we also have memberships at Gold's, yet we choose to come here instead. The facility itself is always clean, even if its a little cluttered some times. But, there is plenty of equipment here from dumbbells from 2.5 lbs all the way up to 100 lbs. They have a couple of squat racks, and benches, and machines for practically every bodypart along with tons of cardio equipment. Every interaction we have had at this gym has been exceptional, whether its other members, or employees. We've made friends with members, and employees as well. There is every demographic being represented in this facility, there are older members who enjoy their social interactions, younger members who enjoy their social interaction, and others in-between who come in to get a workout and leave. The employees at this gym are all nice, courteous, and helpful. My wife and I will be moving again soon, and we are sad that we won't be using this facility anymore. We wish this place, and all their members and employees would just up and move with us.

Gotta move it back up to a "4."  I went there last week and the manager took care of me and I was able to work out with now problem.  Clean facility, good selection of equipment, raquetball courts, spin classes, basketball, arerobics -- it has it all.  I just wish they had longer hours on weekends so I can go there before I go to my thing at the Tucson mall.  My only complaint is one fellow who stands at the equipment and talks politics, weather, the tile on his roof, his ethnic status to anyone who will listen and then takes up a whole section of the locker room when he's in there.  But then what gym doesn't have his type?

Been member here since they first opened. They just did huge renno (without warning) but you'd never know the people who laid out/purchased the new equipment had ever been to a gym. Oh but they did add a useless sitting lounge area in the front. If they changed it back I would maybe say 4 stars.

This location is great.   It seems to be kept up and maintained.  This is a bigger LA Fitness and can handle the larger crowds.  It gets too busy around 5 to get most stuff done during Mondays and Tuesdays, but later or earlier times are not  a problem.

Lots of classes and a very clean locker room.

My only complaint would be for LA Fitness to enforce members to wipe off machines and benches like other gyms I have joined.  They have antibacterial cleaner and paper towels for everyone to use, but I never see anyone using them.  In fact, when you do go to wipe down machines prior to another person using it, people often look at you weird.  Anyway, that is the only complaint to what is a great gym in the neighborhood.
Locations at both Ina Rd and Oracle Rd have equipment that is out dated and or needs repair.  If in need of repairs the average time to complete the repairs is at least 3-4 weeks.

Evette is the best employee la fitness has had working at the front desk. She always greets you with a smile on her face and has a great positive attitude. Don't listen to the negative reviews I have been coming to this location for over two years and haven't had a bad experience.

I hadn't been there recently but finally visited last week and want to reiterate how great this Fitness Center at this location still is.  I stopped off when I arrived in Tucson, asked for a visitor's pass and they accommodated me in a flash.  They have the same clean locker rooms, the same competent staff, and the same equipment.  They even had the same gentleman who goes there to socialize but not exercise.  My only complaints are the hours are too short on weekends.  I would have gone there on Saturday and Sunday evening if they were open.  The best time to go seems to be between 0700 and 0900 when it's not very crowded and a lot of equipment is available.

Still going here after over 3 months.  Very crowded after work.  The fees are reasonable though and it has a pool so I've been happy with it.  Most of the other people going here have been friendly.  There are two in Tucson, the one I go to is by the Park Mall at Wilmot & Broadway.

I've been a member here for about 8 months and I can honestly say this is an amazing crossfit gym. It captures everything great about crossfit, community, health, awesome coaching, challenging workouts, great programming, and a supportive network. 

Naptown is also in the process of expanding its offerings and locations. I strongly recommend Naptown if you want to try Crossfit for the first time, get fit, or meet people if you're new new to the city. 

The community is one of a kind :)

I dropped in for a few classes here when I was in town for work. The facility is big and the trainers were very knowledgeable and encouraging. The first class I felt a little weird and almost nobody, except the trainers, introduced themselves to me. I come from a very close-knit box that has a super welcoming community. The second and third classes had more people who were welcoming and made me feel comfortable. Could just be because the box is so big that many members don't know one another? Either way the programming and staff was great!
Super crowded, staff are pretty good at being salesman. Don't believe that prices change daily and they will try to sell you a membership if you use a guest pass.

I like this gym. I have never had to wait on a machine while people sit around and talk. even during busy times. i will admit it had been 6 months since i walked in to a gym due to family issues and stuff. i felt like i was starting at the gym as a newbie.

I walked in and they had more tredmills and added extra room for the weight machines. it does not have the huge retail area the other gym i went had but for $30 cheaper than the previous place I deal the best i can. 

for roughly $16 a month, i get access to all the locations in the area.

Overall, if you just want to get in, get your stuff done, and then get out, it's great! Don't expect to strike up a convo with anyone. But, the machines are nice, they seem clean, and I haven't seen one out of order yet. 
However... They obviously want you to do the upgraded membership, don't walk in thinking you'll easily be able to purchase the $10 membership. The girl that signed us up (tall, dark hair, physically fit) literally rolled her eyes at us and her "I'm so nice and helpful" routine quickly ended when we turned her down for the upgraded membership. 
But, again, aside from her, we're definitely fans of this location.

STAY AWAY!  TOTAL THIEVES.  The worst customer service I have ever received.  I went to this studio for awhile and enjoyed it.  Then I had to cancel for medical reasons, so I went into the studio, spoke with the guy at the desk and filled out a cancellation form.  They kept billing my credit card, so I went back in and showed them my cancellation form.  The guys at the desk said sorry, we'll refund you.  A week later, the manager calls me and says I'm a liar, that I forged the form, he's not refunding my money, and he's going to keep billing me.  Then he said I need to come back in AGAIN to fill out another form.  I could not believe it.  The manager called me a liar and a forger and pledged to keep steeling my money.  WTF?

DEFINITELY DON'T SIGN A MONTHLY CONTRACT!  They might steal your money, too.  Then call you a liar.

Haven't used the gym yet, looks amazing!  Just got a membership.  I just wanna say that the process of walking in, being greated by the owner and talking about what I was looking for in a gym was comfortable and refreshing.  Mike, the owner, was greeting everybody by name and had a super-fun and friendly atmosphere!  As I walked the premise with Mike, I was in awe of the cleanliness and quality/newness of the equipment. Glad I made the move to get in there and thanks for you help Anytime!

Horrible customer service. 

I signed up for the 3-day VIP pass and brought it with me on my smartphone. I drove there after work today and stood in line at the front desk. I was hoping to see the whole facility, especially the pool, which is what brought me to the less-convenient Gold's over Club Fitness in the first place.

The woman at the desk didn't smile. She asked how she could help me. I said I had signed up for the 3-day pass and I wanted to see the facility. She asked whether I had the pass. I said I did and pulled out my smartphone. She said the pass had to be printed to be accepted. "Oh," I said. She said that the pass even states that it must be printed. "Oh," I said again. I have since looked at the pass and it does say that, but access to the gym seems like something that could be arranged by a manager. 

"And you have to bring an ID with a photo and a nearby address."

By then I understood I wasn't getting in today, but I asked what nearby meant. "Within 25 miles."

My address isn't within 25 miles of there... so I guess I won't be able to get in even if I print that pass. I don't know why where I live matters if I'll eventually be a paying customer, but whatever. 

"I guess I'm not getting in today, then?" I asked her.

"No," she said. 

"Okay," I said, and I left. She was fine with that. 

Things that would have made this more than a one star review:
Two stars: saying and acting sympathetic to my plight. 
Three stars: finding someone to take me on a tour of the facility and tell me about classes.
Four stars: arranging for me to use the gym.
Five stars: impressing me with anything at all. 

I wasted 30-minutes round-trip driving there, too. 

Yeah. I really don't think I'll be back.

Everything in here is brand new, which is nice!  The staff is super friendly and it's never been packed whenever I've gone. True this place is slightly higher priced than other places, but not by a lot. It's definitely worth it. And the lap pool is well taken care of! If recommend this gym, even for beginners. I'm just getting back into working out after a year off and everyone still is nice. There really aren't your typical meatheads here.

Horrible, horrible, HORRIBLE customer service AND the Manager committed fraud by continuing to charge my husband's credit card AFTER our cancelation was supposed to be in effect.  Thank God for credit card disputes!

The only problem I had at this location was the Manager.  It is quite unbelievable that she is even a Manager at a gym for starters, but add to that the fact that she is rude, unprofessional, and could not care less about the member experience.  She actually rarely comes out of the back office where she sits all day doing God knows what.

In addition to this, the equipment at this location is always gross and dirty.  I will never step foot in this gym again and I will certainly not recommend it to anyone I know.

This is a great Gold's Gym location. It's a smaller gym, which I like, and is not intimidating at all. The staff members are very friendly and welcoming. The trainers are also available to offer help or educate you if you ask. The locker rooms are clean, and maintenance is usually preformed quickly on broken equipment.

The front desk staff are welcoming and never push anything outside of how's your day, which i really appreciate. The equipment is well kept up with and work orders seem to get repaired very quickly. For those interested there are 3 squat racks, 1 power rack, and a deadlift platform. Everyone there is really nice and respectful and there isn't any gym intimidation. Pool, hot tub and sauna are great and always working.

I think I was too harsh on City Fitness. I have a one month pass I got in the mail to try it out, and it's growing on me. the biggest downside to me is that it doesn't have the equipment I've come to know and love at the Penn Pottruck gym. if you're really into crossfit style workouts, this isn't really the place for you (unless you join Thrive and work out in their area which looks to have amazing equipment!). there are no bumper plates, and i really wish they would leave an extra barbell permanently in the area next to the leg press machine for deadlifting (there is a trap bar.. but meh). it's a small space, so they can only fit so much in. there's only one set of 12.5 lb dumbbells downstairs for example- which is a popular size with women, so if other women are lifting i usually have to wait. i also noticed today when i was leaving spin class that they do group personal training downstairs in the astroturf area and take it over which is a bit of a bummer because i love using that equipment (trx ropes/kettlebells). i'm not sure how often that happens though.

on the plus side, it's open almost all the time (5 am to 1 am) - this is HUGE for me. i am a mom and being open that early means i can work out and get home in time to have breakfast with my kiddo before work. same goes for being able to book a spot in a class online ahead of time. it's incredibly convenient. the amount of classes offered is also excellent and i like that there are classes offered on the weekends. i've only gone to spinning so far but every time the instructors have been great. the location is fantastic too if you live or work in G-Ho.

Jamel is the best trainer in Philly. He makes the hour fly by. You walk out of the gym feeling like you just had the best workout of your life. 

He is the only reason I ever get up off the couch and make it in to this place.

This is a fabulous gym.  Considering the cost, it provides a lot of fitness opportunities. I look for a gym that has a lot of classes at various times so that I can fit in exercise before or after work. As my work start and end times change from day to day, though, I need a gym that has classes at various times throughout the early morning and mid to late afternoon.  I found that the class schedule here meets that need. The trainers are excellent.  The spin and row teachers are really exceptional.  Try the We-Fit class, but expect a huge challenge, even if you are fit.  The facility is very clean, but this is a new enterprise, so time will tell if the business will continue to keep things clean and fresh.  I love that the women's locker room contains a blow dryer and extra hair ties.  These little things make a huge difference. Thanks for thinking of them.

The gym part of City Fitness is better than most, good equipment, clean, variety, it's a nice gym. I find the rates reasonable and have been a member since they opened and will continue to be a member. So, for the rating I give the gym at CF a 3.5 star, I give MBSC a 1.5 star for an overall 2.5 star rating.

MBSC review: I thought I would kick it up a notch so joined the MBSC thrive program at CF on South Street and tried it for three months. Trainers really aren't "personal" trainers. They have a set program that they put people through and you have very little to say about what you like/don't like. The trainers work with several people in a session so depending on how many people are in a session you could be waiting for the trainer to get back to you or waiting for the person in front of you to finish. One of the things that frustrated me is they want you to push through the routine they have come up for you in the hour's time. The sessions are hard with ropes, sleds, balls, bands, cables, weights and the most uncomfortable stationary bike I've ever had to sit on (and they make you end every session on the thing). No two sessions are alike - so if you like variety then great, if you like consistency or at least enough repetition to get the moves and form down then not so great. I seldom found a session to be fun or enjoyable, rather I often felt like I was a contestant on the Biggest Loser. They also play hip-hop all day long and you either like it or you don't. The environment and training is designed (in my opinion) to appeal to 20-30yo demographic.

If you really want to push yourself beyond your limits and don't care how you get there then you might really enjoy the MBSC program. If you want a professional personal trainer to spend quality time with you in achieving your goals and if you want a training program that you actually learn what muscle groups you are working and not just to be pushed through a routine then you probably won't like MBSC. Definitely do a introductory program because the usual 30 day notice from the contract date applies if you cancel and it's $200+/mo program.

This gym is pretty decent.  It's small so just know that going into it.  I was used to PSC where there was a ton of different types of equipment so it took a week or so for me to adjust to a smaller gym.  The staff is very pleasant and is probably the best gym staff I have ever seen in my 15 years of being a gym rat.  The personal trainers actually look the part!  This isn't always the case at other gyms which has always been confusing to me.
 
My only complaint about the gym would be the use of the space on the upper floor.  It looks like they could fit more equipment (weight machines or free weights) on this floor.  Additionally, one room has a really nice set of circuit equipment in it and suspension training equipment in it but it is always occupied by the "We Fit" class.  It's a great class and I am sure the members who take it regularly love it but the class is given at 5:30 pm and 6:30 pm eliminating that entire room and all of its equipment during the busiest hours of the gym.  It doesn't make much sense to me to dedicate that room during those busy hours to a very small percentage of members working out.  The equipment in that room would relieve the wait times and overflow in the free weight room and the only other weight circuit.
 
Overall the gym does the trick and I can get a good workout in.  Like I said, the staff is great which is sometimes hard to find in a gym.  I was told there would be a juice bar but there have been no signs of it yet.
Class schedule met my needs but the yoga studio is pretty noisy sometime ( from the sound of upstairs).

Really? $45.00 to "hold my rate?" The trick fees and surprise billing that shows up in my checking account every few months is garbage. The monthly fee doesn't sound so bad, but the surprise fees and the $100.00 fee to cancel the account is somewhat discouraging as well. 

You can work out here if you're rich and have money to blow, but being a member here has severe financial disadvantages.

everyone who works here is so insanely friendly. i love going because i feel like i see all my friends / neighbors here and its just feels so nice. the fact that its got that neighborhood "spot" feel is the motivation i need to work out. the price is right, i got the "day before they opened" price, and its cheap and includes classes!!!!! i'm just so glad to have city fitness in my hood. i love going and i love the way i feel after i leave. 
love u guys!

I personally have had a good experience so far. Although there were a few problems scheduling my appointment with a personal trainer, my sister and I got a sweet deal on our membership; we got to split the cost since we live in the same household. It can be a bit busy around 5pm but that's a normal occurrence at any gym.

This gym has just about everything that you can imagine to work out with. I haven't even tried any of the classes yet but the variety of machines and equipment keeps me busy enough. 2 different floors with multiple rooms so it never seems overly crowded. This City Fitness has a bunch of kettle bells, try ropes, machines and free weights along with a good amount of cardio machines. It's a little pricey and kind of far from me, but the gym itself is in great condition and has everything you want for almost any type of workout.

Love this gym. Ample amount of space for cardio and weights. Never an issue with wait times or searching for a particular weight. Staff is friendly and helpful. I haven't participated in any classes yet so don't reference me yet for those opinions. Four stars

Having just moved down to Center City from West Philly, this Gym is great compared with the Penn gym I had access to for the last four years.  Do I think a television and fan in every piece of aerobic equipment is unnecessary? Yes, but am I complaining about it? NO! It is awesome! Though I have heard that is standard now.  

The facilities are great, very clean and well maintained, and it looks like it will stay that way.  The staff is incredibly friendly and willing to take care of any issue a member might have.

Sorry City Fitness, but I have to downgrade you a star.  The facility is fine, and the staff is nice, but they are driving me crazy with the class schedule.  First, there are a lot of classes that are offered during the day when most of the people that live in this neighborhood are at work.  For those of us that want to work out on the morning, there are very few options for classes.  Given that, when I do show up for a morning class I expect to have the class.  I have gone there at least 4 times for a class only to find out that the class was cancelled.  This morning in particular, there were about 10 of us in the group exercise room all set up for body pump, only to find out that the instructor overslept.  They have to come up with some kind of system to alert people to cancelled classes if someone is sick or something at the last minute, but otherwise I don't understand why the classes aren't running.  They've been open over a month, and the class schedule has been the same the whole time.  I will say that the Monday morning spin class always runs, but I think that's the only class I've ever gotten to do in the morning, and I'm not the only one.  Everyone there this morning was extremely frustrated because it keeps happening.  I'll happily update again if they get their act together, but for now this is unacceptable.

Okay, so let's just recap my experience.

I signed up, they changed the price and charged all members for a price change.  Odd.

I signed up thinking they had decent classes.  They have not only changed a lot of my favorite classes to 5:30 PM (I'm sorry, but if you work, who the heck is making these 5:30 classes), but they also still call one of the classes "cardio combat" when it is not.  The girl who took Chuck's place is not a certified cardio combat instructor, so it is really misleading to continue to call it that.

Als huge caveat: if you do get a membership here expect a few things.  1) They won't offer to print out your contract, so make sure you get one.  2) They will bully you into a personal training session, just like LA Fitness 3) They hit you with a ton of hidden fees and can change your membership fee at anytime without any advanced warning 

I go here simply because I love the cardio combat class that Chuck teaches.  If it weren't for him, I'd change gyms.
I ended up canceling my membership in person because I'm doing crossfit now. I had zero problems with billing and the process was straightforward.

How appropriate that a piss poor start be bookended with a piss poor ending to my relationship with City Fitness. It's been 2 months and they still won't acknowledge that I am not a member. I exaggerate not one iota in writing that I had to look up and quote Commonwealth legislation in my defense. Now they just won't respond to my e-mails.

Laughable.

8/26 UPDATE:  since my last review, City Fitness contacted me and took the fees off and resolved the matter- I appreciate their follow up and their decision to resolve this issue swiftly.

That said, I would like to give my two cents to my fellow Yelpers about what I took away from this experience and the additional understanding I gained while reviewing other gyms in concurrence with this issue. Be CAUTIOUS, while dealing with gyms in general, be it City Fitness or any other. Read the fine print! Seems like reviewers, across Gyms in Philadelphia, have had similar issues, and the consistently high frequency of these cases across Gyms indicate that these are most likely not to be honest mistakes for the most part.

NOTE - Please beware that my lack of membership experience with other Philly gyms makes me a less than ideal candidate to draw a comparison on how City Fitness would fare w.r.t them or vice versa.

I hear great things about the Northern Liberties location, but did not experience the same for the Graduate Hospital location.
The gym itself is decent. It is very clean, has okay cardio/lifting equipment, and the classes were so-so.
I quit because of the awful staff and price. Aside from the nightmare of breaking my contract, there are rate lock fees and the overall experience is just not worth the money. 
The majority of front desk staff is rude and not helpful. They were constantly gossiping and ignoring members. Billing/membership was difficult and unpleasant to deal with. While I have not met the owner, I have heard bad things from both members and gossiping staff about his unkindness and difficulty to deal with. Not the kind of attitude that attracts me to a gym where I come to de-stress! 
Overall, breaking my contract was worth it and I now go to Sweat on Market St. This was not the kind of business I like to support!

The juice bar is now open and they have added some additional cardio and weight equipment.  This includes a leg press/sled and a pec/delt fly machine that are very nice.  The only issue now is the temperature upstairs... What is going on with the A/C?  Overall a very good gym!
Cleanest gym I've ever seen. They do need a second squat rack, and it does get very crowded at peak hours.

Favorite classes: sunday 9am hard core, Tuesday 7pm spinning, Friday 11am butts and guts. I do wish there were more 6pm class options but overall the gym is great! Friendly staff, large, lots of equipment and classes.
Welcoming environment, good classes, good facilities, upbeat attitude!

I recently switched over from Sweat Fitness to City Fitness purely out of location and convenience.  I must say that I really like this gym - everything is clean and it's pretty rare that machines are out of service, which is great.  

On top of the regular work outs (which honestly aren't regular enough for me), I've taken a handful of spin classes and have enjoyed each one.  The only issue I have with the classes is this whole "call ahead to reserve a spot" thing.  Maybe it's just me, but I think you should have to be in the gym ready for the class in order to sign up.  There have been times where I'm put on standby and can either wait the 15 minutes until the class starts to hope someone's a no-show or just go ahead and do my normal routine - I hate that.  (Or maybe I should just stop complaining and just call ahead to reserve my spot like everyone else?  Probably.)

Anyway, City Fitness is a pretty great establishment.  If you're looking for a new gym, I highly suggest checking it out!

Things have greatly changed at this gym -  if you can ignore the unbelievable rudeness of the administration, then you won't have any problems working out at this great gym with the best hours in Philadelphia - I, however, would rather spend my money elsewhere.

If it weren't for the Northern Liberties location near my office I probably wouldn't be a member of City Fitness. The South Street spot is super cramped, with most of the workout areas in the basement. The classes are always packed (why don't they have more?!) and the WeFit I've attended have been decent at best.

I will say that the locker rooms are great, and the tanning booths are always open and clean. But for the price I'd prefer to save some money and join Sweat or Bally's, which both offer way better class schedules and open areas.

One star for space, two for the classes and four for the amenities (disregarding square footage). But I must say - the NoLibs location makes up for it in spade. ROCKS - check out my review of that location if you'd like.

This is a decent gym. I joined after getting a groupon, and I've done various deals with gyms in the city and this one is good. I have the basic membership and I don't take classes. For the value of the membership and the facilities, it's worth it. I just want to exercise by myself, indoors, and in air conditioning. I rarely have a problem getting to any of the machines and everyone who works there is very friendly. I get more e-mails than I care for, but the gym itself is pretty good.

This place has potential but feels so disorganized. A few months ago, I bought a Groupon for classes here. I called with some questions and left a message, but no one ever got back to me. The Groupon voucher said it was good for specialty or regular classes. I went on a Sunday and was told it wasn't good for Sunday classes because they are drop-in classes. Not sure how I could have known this since the voucher didn't say Sunday classes were excluded... The Groupon was expiring soon and so I really wanted to redeem the voucher, and they finally agreed to let me use it for that day. 

Last night I signed up and paid for zumba class this morning and dragged myself out of bed only to discover the class was cancelled because they have special workshops today. I've been assured I'll get a refund, but come on - the class should have been cancelled in the system! 

On the other hand...the classes are a lot of fun. I've mainly attended Peter's zumba class and love it! He is so upbeat and energetic - his class is a great way to start off my Saturday morning. I've also attended a class called Pound that uses special drumsticks, and it was a lot of fun. The prices are very reasonable as well. If you decide to go, be sure to bring your own water - oddly enough there isn't a water fountain, at least not that I've seen.
